verse.content: Isa found a young donkey and rode it. This fulfilled what was in the kitab of Allah:
"Do not fear, inhabitants of Al-Quds. Look! Your king is coming, riding on a young donkey."

metadata.item: This is a quotation from the Tawrat, Zakariyya 9:9.

verse.content: His hawariyun did not understand this at that time. But after Allah raised Isa in the majesty of his glory, they remembered this saying of Allah about him, and what happened to him.
The people who were with him when he called Lazarus from the grave and resurrected him alive gave shahada to him.
The crowds gathered to meet him when they heard about this miracle he had done.
The Pharisees discussed the matter. They said, "Look how nothing does any good against him. The whole world has followed him!"
Some Greek people came to worship at the eid.

metadata.item: These would have been Greek people who had converted to the Yahudi religion.

verse.content: They came to Philip the hawari, who grew up in Bethsaida in Al-Jalil, and said, "Sir, we want to see Isa."

metadata.item: Bethsaida was a town where people spoke Greek, so Philip could communicate with them.

verse.content: Philip went and told Andrew, and both of them told Isa.
Isa answered them, "The hour has come for the majesty of the glory of sayyid al-bashar to be shown.
I tell you a true, true saying: "If a grain of wheat does not fall into the earth and die, it remains only a single grain of wheat. But if it dies, it produces much fruit.
Whoever loves his life will lose it. Whoever hates his life in this world will preserve it for eternal spiritual life.
If anyone serves me, he must follow me. Where I am, my servant will be, and the Most Merciful King will honor him.
My soul is troubled now. Shall I pray in dua' to the Most Loving King to save me from this hour? No! I came to this hour for this purpose.
Most Loving, Glorious King, show the majesty of the glory of your name." A voice came from heaven, "I have shown the majesty of its glory, and I will show it again."

metadata.item: This refers to the Arabic name Al-Majid, one of the 99 names of Allah.

verse.content: The crowds surrounding him heard the voice and said, "This is thunder." Others said, "An angel has spoken to him."
Isa answered them, "This voice has come for your sake, not for mine.
The appointment for judgment of this world and casting out of its ruler Al-Shaitan has come.
When I have been lifted up from the earth, I will attract everyone to me."
By this saying, he was referring to how he would die.

metadata.item: A person who was crucified was lifted onto the cross.

verse.content: The crowds said, "We have heard from the kitab that al-masih will remain forever. How can you say that sayyid al-bashar will be raised up? Who is sayyid al-bashar?"

metadata.item: The kitab did not specifically call the one who would remain forever 'al-masih,' but it mentioned one who would remain forever. Both Al-Yahud and followers of Isa believe that the person referred to is al-masih. See the Tawrat, Daniel 2:44, 7:13-14, Shaya 9:6-7, Ezekiel 37:25, and the Zabur, Psalms 16:10, 45:6, 89:29,36, 110:4.
Al-Yahud apparently understood that Isa was talking about dying and being resurrected.

verse.content: So Isa told them, "The light is with you for a little while longer. So walk while you have the light, so that darkness will not overtake you. The person who walks in darkness is ignorant and does not know his destiny.

metadata.item: Isa. See Yahya 8:1.

verse.content: Trust in the light while it is with you, so you will become sons of light." After Isa said this, he left them and hid from them.

metadata.item: The word sons here is obviously not literal. It refers to the people who follow the light of Allah.

verse.content: But they did not believe in him despite his many ayat and miracles.
By their kufr, they fulfilled what Allah had revealed in the scroll of the nabi Shaya: "Our Rabb, who believed our message? To whom was your right hand revealed?"

metadata.item: Allah does not have a body, and the phrase "right hand" is not literal. The meaning of "right hand" is usually the power of Allah.
This is a quotation from the Tawrat, Shaya 53:1.

verse.content: For this reason, they could not believe. Allah revealed in the same scroll,
"He made their eyes blind, and hardened their hearts. So they did not see with their eyes, understand with their hearts, and repent. If they did, I would have healed them."

metadata.item: This is a quotation from the Tawrat, Shaya 6:10.

verse.content: Allah revealed that through his nabi Shaya, when he showed him the majesty of the glory of the expected al-masih.

metadata.item: This could be a reference to the Tawrat, Shaya 6,9, or 53.

verse.content: Despite that, many of the leaders of Al-Yahud believed in him, but because of their fear of the Pharisees, they did not make their faith known. If they did, they would have been cast out from the house of salat.
They loved the rida of people more than the rida of Allah.
Then Isa shouted, "The person who trusts in me trusts in the One who sent me, not just in me."
The person who has seen me has seen the One who sent me.
I have come as light to all people. No one who trusts in me will remain in darkness.

metadata.item: Or to the universe.

verse.content: If anyone hears my words and does not follow them, I will not condemn him. I did not come to condemn all people, but to ransom all people.
The person who rejects me and does not follow my words will be condemned on Yawm Al-Din. My word will condemn him.
I do not speak by myself. I am the rasul of the Most Loving King, who has commanded me what to say.
I know that his command is eternal spiritual life. Everything I say is truly what the Most Loving King says."
Isa knew before Passover Eid that the hour for him to leave this world and go to the Most Loving King had come. He had loved his supporters in this world. But now he showed them this maximum love.
When it was dinner time, Iblis had put betraying Isa into the heart of Yahuda, son of Simon Iscariot, the hawari.
Isa knew that the Most Loving King had delegated everything to him. He also knew that he was rasul Allah and would return to Allah.
So he got up from dinner, took off his robe, and tied a towel around him.
He filled a basin with water, and started washing the feet of the hawariyun and wiping their feet with the towel wrapped around him.
When he came to Simon Peter, Peter said to him, "My mawla, are you going to wash my feet?"
Isa answered him, "You do not understand what I am doing now. But you will understand it later."
Peter said, "You will never wash my feet." Isa answered him, "If I do not wash you, you have no portion in me."
Simon Peter said, "My mawla, then not just my feet. Wash my hands and my head also."
Isa told him, "The person who has washed is basically tahir. All that remains is washing his feet. You are tahir, but not all of you."

metadata.item: The hawariyun.

verse.content: He said that all of them were not tahir because he knew who was going to betray him.
Then after washing their feet, he put his robe on, reclined, and asked them, "Do you know the meaning of what I have done to you?

metadata.item: People ate by a low table or on the floor and leaned on their left side, eating with their right hands. See also verse 23.

verse.content: You call me 'Our teacher' and 'our mawla', and you are correct, since that is what I am.
I, your teacher and mawla, have washed your feet. In a similar way, you must wash the feet of each other.
I have given you an example. You must follow my example.
I tell you a true, true saying: A slave is not higher than his master, and a rasul is not higher than the one who sent him.
You have a blessing if you know this and act on it.
I do not mean all of you. I know the people I have chosen. But what Allah revealed in the Zabur must truly happen: The person who ate bread with me has turned against me.

metadata.item: This is a quotation from the Zabur, Psalms 41:9.

verse.content: From now on, I will tell you what will happen before it happens. This is so you will believe that I am he when it is fulfilled.

metadata.item: Isa probably meant that he was al-masih.

verse.content: I tell you a true, true saying: Whoever welcomes my rasul has welcomed me. And whoever welcomes me welcomes the one who sent me."

metadata.item: The rasul sent by Isa. The hawariyun were the first ones sent out by Isa.

verse.content: After that, the ruh of Isa was troubled. He gave shahada: "I tell you a true, true saying: One of you will betray me."
The hawariyun looked at one another. They were puzzled about whom he meant.
The hawari who was beloved to the heart of Isa was reclining next to him.

metadata.item: Most probably Yahya the hawari. See chapter 21:20,24.

verse.content: Simon Peter motioned to him, telling him to ask Isa whom he meant.

metadata.item: There were many hand motions by which people could communicate without words.

verse.content: So he leaned on the chest of Isa and asked him, "My mawla, who is it?"
Isa answered, "It is the one I will give this bite to after I have dipped it." So he dipped it and gave it to Yahuda, son of Simon Iscariot.

metadata.item: Bread was a main food, and there was a common dish in the middle of the table. People dipped a piece of the bread in the dish and then ate it.

verse.content: Then Al-Shaitan entered Yahuda after he ate the bite. Isa told him, "Do what you are going to do quickly."
No one eating dinner understood what he meant by his words to Yahuda.
Some of them thought that he was telling him to buy what they needed for the eid. Others thought that he was telling him to give alms to the poor, because he kept the money box.
He went out immediately after eating the bite. It was night time.

metadata.item: Yahuda.

verse.content: After Yahuda left, Isa said, "Now the majesty of the glory of sayyid al-bashar will appear, in which the majesty of the glory of Allah will appear also.
Allah will show the majesty of the glory of sayyid al-bashar in himself, and show the majesty of his glory immediately.
My sons, I will remain with you for a little time. As I told Al-Yahud previously, I tell you now: You will search for me, and where I go, you will not be able to come.

metadata.item: The word sons here is not literal. Isa was never married and had no sons. The meaning here is those hawariyun of Isa whom Isa loves and cares for like a father.

verse.content: My new command for you is to love each other. As I have loved you, love each other.
Everyone will know that you are my followers because of your love for each other."
Simon Peter asked him, "My mawla, where are you going?" Isa answered him, "You cannot follow me now where I am going. But you will follow me later."
Peter said to him, "My mawla, why can I not follow you now? I will sacrifice my life for you!"
Isa answered him, "Will you really sacrifice your life for me? I tell you a true, true saying: You will deny me three times before the rooster calls."
"Let not your hearts be troubled. You trust in Allah. Trust in me also.
There are many dwellings in the house of my Most Loving King. If this were not so, I would have told you. I am going so I can prepare a place for you.
After I go and prepare a place for you, I will return to take you to me, so that you will be where I am.
You know the way to my destination."
Thomas the hawari told him, "Our mawla, we do not know your destination. How can we know the way?"
Isa told him, "I am al-sirat, the truth, and the life. No one comes to the Most Gracious King except through me.
If you really knew me, you would know my Most Loving King, too. From now on, you know him and have seen him."
Philip the hawari told him, "Our mawla, show us the Most Loving King clearly. That will be enough for us."
Isa told him, "After all this long time I have spent with you, do you not know me, Philip? Anyone who has seen me has seen the Most Loving King. How can you say: Show us the Most Loving King?

metadata.item: Isa was not saying that he was the Most Loving King, but that he had the same nature as the Most Loving King. Isa was conceived by Holy Ruh Allah, so he had a nature from Allah through Holy Ruh Allah. When Philip saw Isa, he saw the nature Isa had, which was from Holy Ruh Allah.

verse.content: Do you not believe that I am in the Most Loving King and the Most Loving King is in me? My words to you are not from myself, but from the Most Loving King who remains in me. He is the one who does all his ayat.
Believe me that I am in the Most Loving King and that the Most Loving King is in me. Or believe me because of the ayat themselves.
I tell you a true, true saying: The people who trust in me will do the same ayat that I do, and more than that, since I am returning to the Most Loving King.
I will respond to you, whatever you ask in dua' in my name. This is so that the majesty of the glory of the Most Loving King will be shown in the beloved amir.

metadata.item: The amir, or prince, is the representative or agent or mediator.

verse.content: If you ask me anything in my name, I am the answerer.

metadata.item: This refers to the Arabic name Al-Mujib, one of the 99 names of Allah.

verse.content: If you love me, you will follow my commands.
And I will ask the Most Gracious, Best Giving King to support you with another helper, who will be with you forever.

metadata.item: This refers to the Arabic name Al-Wahab, one of the 99 names of Allah.

Some people who have not read the verses carefully think that Isa was referring to a person, but the verses that follow make it clear that he is not speaking of a person, but of Holy Ruh Allah. The verses say that this helper would be with the hawariyun forever (16). He would be called the Ruh of truth. (17) People of this world could not receive him. (17) People of this world could not see him. (17) People of this world do not know him. (17) The hawariyun of Isa knew him. (17) He remained with the hawariyun. (17) He would live within the hawariyun. (17) None of these descriptions apply to a person, but only to Holy Ruh Allah. And verse 26 specifically says that the helper is Holy Ruh Allah.

verse.content: He is the Ruh of truth, whom people of this world cannot receive, because they do not see him and they do not know him. But you know him, because he remains with you and will live within you.
I will not leave you alone like orphans. I will come to you.
After a little time, the people of this world will not see me. But you will see me. Since I will be alive, you will also be alive.
In that day, you will know that I live in my Most Loving King, and you live in me, and I in you.
The one who really loves me takes my commands and follows them. My Most Loving King loves the person who loves me. And I love him and show myself to him."
Yahuda (not Yahuda Iscariot) asked him, "Our mawla, what will happen so that you can show yourself to us, and not show it to the people of the world?"
Isa answered him, "If someone loves me, he will follow my word. The Most Loving King will love him, and we will come to him and live with him.
But the person who does not love me does not follow my words. The word that you are hearing is not from myself. It is from the Most Loving King who sent me.
I have spoken about these things while I was with you.
But Holy Ruh Allah, who is the helper whom the Most Gracious King will send in my name, will teach you everything, and remind you of everything I have spoken to you.
I will leave peace with you. I will give you my peace. I will not give you in the same way as this world gives. Do not let your hearts fear.

You heard me when I said that I am going and then returning to you. If you loved me, you would have rejoiced, because I am going to the Most Loving King, and the Most Loving King is greater than I am.

metadata.item: See verse 3.

verse.content: I have told you what will happen before it happens so that you will believe with total trust when it happens.
I will not talk much longer with you, because Al-Shaitan, the ruler of this world, is coming. He has no authority over me.

metadata.item: Isa was sinless, and Al-Shaitan could not entice him to sin.

verse.content: And I do what the Most Loving King commands me, so that everyone in world will know I love him. Get up. Let us go from here."

metadata.item: Allah.

verse.content: "I am the true vine, and My Most Loving King is the vine keeper.

metadata.item: The word vine is not literal, of course. The meaning here is that Isa is the source of spiritual fruit.

verse.content: Every unfruitful branch in me will be cut off. And he trims every fruitful branch so that it would be more fruitful.

metadata.item: A person who claims to be a follower of Isa but who does not hold (or produce) spiritual fruit.

verse.content: You are tahir because of my word that I spoke to you.

metadata.item: "You" in this passage is plural, referring to the hawariyun.

verse.content: Remain firmly in me, and I in you. A branch does not produce fruit by itself. It must be firmly attached to the vine. You will not produce fruit unless you remain firmly attached to me.

metadata.item: The fruit that comes from being connected with Isa includes love, joy, peace, patience, kindness, goodness, faithfulness, gentleness, and self-control. See the Injil, Galatians 5:22-23.

verse.content: I am the vine and you are the branches. The only person who produces much fruit is one who is firmly attached to me and I am firmly attached to him. You cannot do anything when you are separate from me.
If anyone does not remain firmly attached to me, he is like a branch that is thrown away and dries up. His destiny is to be gathered and thrown as fuel into the fire.
But if you remain firmly attached to me, and my words remain in you, pray for whatever you want in dua', and it will be answered.
The majesty of the glory of my Most Loving King will be shown if you produce much fruit. Then you will really be my followers.
I have loved you as the Most Loving King has loved me. Remain firmly attached to my love.
If you follow my commands, you will remain firmly attached to my love. This is the same way I follow the commands of the Most Loving King and remain firmly attached to his love.
I have told you this so that my joy would remain within you, and your joy would be completed.
This is my command to you: Love each other as I have loved you.
There is no greater love than the love of someone who sacrifices his life as a ransom for people he loves.
You are the people I love if you obey my command to you.
I no longer consider you my slaves, but people I love. The slave does not know what his master is doing. But I have told you everything I heard from my Most Loving King.
You did not choose me, but I chose you. And I appointed you to go and produce lasting fruit. Then the Most Gracious King will answer every dua' you pray in my name.

metadata.item: Isa is the intercessor or mediator for people. He is the only possible mediator, because he is the only person who has both a divine nature from Holy Ruh Allah as well as a human nature from his mother. Furthermore, he is qualified to be a mediator, since he is without sin against people or against Allah, and he obeyed Allah in everything, doing all his works with the permission of Allah and according to the will of Allah.

verse.content: This is my command to you: Love each other.
If people of this world hate you, know that they hated me before you.
If you were people of this world, this world would love you as its own people. But I chose you out of it. That is why the people of this world hate you.

Remember my word to you: A slave is not higher than his master. If the people of this world have persecuted me, they will persecute you in the same way. If they have followed my word, in the same way they will follow your words.
They will do all these things to you because of my name, because they do not know the One who sent me.
If I had not come and spoken to them, they would not have a sin. But now there is no justification for their sin.
The person who hates me also hates my Most Loving King.

There have never before been ayat and miracles on the earth like the ones I have done. Otherwise, they would not have a sin. But now, they have seen all the ayat, and have hated both me and my Most Loving King.

metadata.item: Isa had done all the miracles that Al-Yahud believed that only al-masih could do.

verse.content: This truly fulfills what Allah revealed in the Zabur: They hated without a reason.

metadata.item: This is a reference to the Zabur, Psalms 69:4, 35:19.

verse.content: The helper is the Ruh of truth who comes from the Most Gracious King. He will give shahada for me when I send him to you from the Most Gracious King.
You will give shahada for me also, because you have been with me since the beginning of my message."
"I have told you all this so that you will not turn back.
The Yahudi leaders will cast you out from the houses of salat. The time is actually coming when people who kill you will imagine that they are doing jihad in the sirat of Allah.
They will do that because they do not know the Most Gracious King and they do not know me.
I have warned you in advance. That is so you will remember what I have warned you of when it happens. I did not tell you this at the beginning of my message, because I was with you.
But now I will go to the One who sent me. But none of you asks me: Where are you going?
And sadness has filled your hearts because of my words.
But I tell you a true saying: My going away is better for you, because the helper will not come to you until after I go. Then when I go, I will send him to you.
When he comes, he will make the injustice of the people of this world clear, in the areas of sin, righteousness, and judgment.
As for sin, it is because they refused to trust in me.

metadata.item: People who do not acknowledge their sin do not see the need to trust Isa the sinless one.

verse.content: As for righteousness, it is because I am going to the Most Loving King and you will not see me again.

metadata.item: Allah vindicated the righteousness of Isa by resurrecting him from death and raising him to himself.

verse.content: As for judgment, it is because Al-Shaitan, the ruler of this world, has been condemned.

metadata.item: If Al-Shaitan is condemned, then those who follow him will also be condemned.

verse.content: I have a lot to tell you, but you cannot bear it now.
When the Ruh of truth comes, he will guide you into all truth. He will not speak by himself. Rather, he will say what he hears. And he will prophesy about what will happen.

metadata.item: Hears from Allah.

verse.content: He will reveal the majesty of my glory, because he will tell you what he receives from me.
Everything that the Most Loving King has is mine. That is why I said that he will tell you what he receives from me.

metadata.item: Because Isa is the amir.

verse.content: After a little time, you will not see me. Then after a little time more, you will see me."

metadata.item: The next afternoon, when Isa died.
The third day after Isa died, when he was resurrected.

verse.content: Some of the hawariyun asked each other, "What does he mean by his saying: 'After a little time, you will not see me, then after a little time more, you will see me'? And what does he mean by going to the Most Loving King?"
They continued, "What does his saying 'After a little time' mean? We do not know what he means by his sayings."

Isa realized that the hawariyun wanted to ask him, so he said to them, "Are you asking each other about the meaning of my saying, 'After a little time, you will not see me, then after a little time more, you will see me'?
I tell you a true, true saying: The people of this world will be happy, and you will cry and mourn. You will be sad, and then your sadness will be changed to joy.

metadata.item: At the death of Isa.
After Isa was resurrected from death.

verse.content: A pregnant woman is sad when her hour comes. But after the birth of her child, she is happy. She does not remember her pain anymore, because a baby has entered the world.

metadata.item: To give birth

verse.content: In the same way now, you also will be sad. But then I will see you again, and your hearts will be happy with a joy that no one can take away.
On that day, you will no longer ask me anything. I tell you a true, true saying: The Most Gracious King will answer every dua' you pray in my name.
Until now, you have not prayed a dua' in my name. Pray in dua' and the Best Giver will answer you. Then your joy will be complete.

metadata.item: This refers to the Arabic name Al-Wahab, one of the 99 names of Allah.

verse.content: I have told you stories. But the time will come when I will tell you about the Most Gracious King. I will tell you clearly, not with stories.
On that day, you will pray in dua' to Allah in my name. I do not tell you that I will ask the Most Loving King on your behalf.

metadata.item: The followers could ask Allah themselves.

verse.content: The Most Loving King himself loves you because you love me. And you have believed that I was sent from Allah.
I am the rasul of the Most Loving King and I came into this world. Now I am leaving this world and returning to the Most Loving King."

metadata.item: The word of Allah existed before it was sent to Mariam and it became Isa.

verse.content: His hawariyun said, "Now your words are clear, with no stories.
Now we realize that you know everything. You do not need anyone to ask you. So we believe that you are rasul Allah."
Isa answered them, "Do you believe now?

The hour will come -- actually, it is already here -- when you will be scattered. Each hawari will go his own way. You will leave me alone. But I will not be alone, because the Most Loving King is with me.

metadata.item: This happened a few hours later (chapter 18 in this scroll).

verse.content: I told you this so that you will have peace in me. In this world, you will suffer severe trials. But be encouraged and patient. I have overcome this world."
After Isa said this, he looked up and prayed in dua', "Most Loving King, the hour has come. Give glory to the majesty of your beloved amir, so that your beloved amir can give glory to your majesty.
You have delegated authority to me over all people. That is so that I can give eternal spiritual life to everyone whom you have given me.

metadata.item: Or the universe.

verse.content: (Eternal spiritual life is for them to know you, the One True Allah, and to know your rasul Isa al-masih.)

metadata.item: This refers to the Arabic names Al-Ahad and Al-Haqq, two of the 99 names of Allah.

verse.content: I have shown your majesty because I have completed the work that you delegated to me.
Most Loving King, restore to me now the majesty of my glory in your presence. I had this glory from you before the creation of the universe.

metadata.item: The Word of Allah was always with Allah. But when Allah sent his Word to Mariam, his majesty and glory were not visible.

verse.content: I showed your name to the people you chose from among all people and gave to me. They were yours, you gave them to me, and they have followed your word.
I know that everything you gave me is from you.
I have delegated to them the words that you delegated to me. And they received them and absolutely believed that I was sent from you. And they believe that you sent me.
I do not ask you on behalf of all people. Rather, I ask you on behalf of the people you have given me, because they are yours.
Everything that is mine is yours. And everything that is yours is mine. And they have shown the majesty of my glory.

I am not in this world any longer. But they will remain in this world. I am returning to you, Holy Most Loving King. Protect them in your name, which you gave to me, so that they will become one, like we are one.

metadata.item: This refers to the Arabic names Al-Qudus, Al-Wadud, and Al-Malik, three of the 99 names of Allah.
Arabic wahid, which is also one of the 99 names of Allah.

verse.content: While I was with them, I was their protector in your name, which you gave me. I did not lose any of them except the one who was a son of Jahannam. What Allah revealed in the kitab truly happened in that.

metadata.item: This refers to the Arabic name Al-Hafiz, one of the 99 names of Allah.
The word son is obviously not literal. Here "son of jahannam" means a person whose destiny is jahannam because of his evil deeds.
This may be a reference to the Zabur, Psalms 41:9.

verse.content: I am returning to you now. I have spoken to them about this while I was in this world, so that my joy may be completed in them.
I have given them your word. The people of this world hated them because they are not from this world. Neither am I from this world.

metadata.item: Isa was sent from Allah to Mariam.

verse.content: I do not ask you to take them from this world. Rather, protect them from the evil, cursed one.

metadata.item: Evil one and cursed one are titles of Al-Shaitan.

verse.content: They are not from this world, just like I am not from this world.
Your word is truth, so make them holy and tahir in your truth.
You sent me into this world. In the same way, I sent them into this world.
I set myself apart for them, so that they also will be set apart for the truth.
I do not ask you on their behalf only, but also for the people who will believe in me through their word.
Most Loving King, I want them all to be united, just as you live in me and I live in you. I ask you that they would be in us, so that all people will believe that you sent me.
You gave me the majesty of your glory, and I gave it to them also. So I want them to be one, just as we are one.
I am in them and you are in me, so that they will be completely one. Then all people will understand that I am your rasul and you loved them as you loved me.
Most Loving King, I want the people you gave me to be with me. Then they can see the majesty of my glory, which you gave me in your love before the creation of the universe.
Most Loving, Righteous King, people of this world did not know you. But I know you and these people know that I am your rasul.

metadata.item: This is related to the Arabic name Al-Barr, one of the 99 names of Allah.
The hawariyun.

verse.content: I showed them your name, and I will continue to show it to them. Then your love will remain in them and I will remain in them."
After he said that, Isa went out with his hawariyun across Kidron Valley. He and his hawariyun entered an orchard.
Yahuda, his betrayer, knew that place, because Isa often met with his hawariyun there.
Yahuda went to the orchard, accompanied by a group of soldiers and officers. The leading ahbar and the Pharisees had sent them with Yahuda. They were carrying lamps, torches, and weapons.
Isa knew everything that was going to happen to him. So he went out to them and said, "Whom do you want?"
They answered, "We want Isa Al-Nasiri." He told them, "I am he." Yahuda, his betrayer, was standing with them.

metadata.item: Or "I am."

verse.content: When he said, "I am he," they withdrew and fell on the ground.

metadata.item: "I am" could have been understood as the name of Allah in their language. This could be the reason they fell down.

verse.content: He asked them again, "Whom do you want?" They said, "We want Isa Al-Nasiri."
He answered them, "I told you: I am he. So if you want me, let these people go."

metadata.item: The hawariyun.

verse.content: His word was truly fulfilled in this, when he said, "I have not lost any of the people you gave me."

metadata.item: Chapter 17:12.

verse.content: Then Simon Peter took his sword out and with it, he hit the slave of the chief habr, who was named Malchus. He cut off his right ear.

metadata.item: Isa healed the ear of the slave, and this probably saved the life of Peter. See Luke 22:51.

verse.content: Isa commanded Peter, "Put your sword back! Should I not drink the cup that the Most Gracious King has prepared for me according to his will?"

metadata.item: The cup of suffering and death. In the Tawrat, a cup often referred to the anger of Allah.

verse.content: The soldiers, the commander, and the officers of Al-Yahud arrested Isa and tied him.
Then they led him to Annas, who was the father-in-law of Caiaphas, the chief habr that year.
Caiaphas was the person who advised the Yahudi leaders that it was better for them that one man die as a ransom for the nation.

metadata.item: The nation of Bani Israil. He said this in the Injil, Yahya 11:50.

verse.content: Simon Peter and the other hawari followed them. The chief habr knew the other hawari, so he entered the courtyard behind Isa.

metadata.item: Probably Yahya son of Zebedee.

verse.content: Peter was standing outside the door. The other hawari whom the chief habr knew returned outside and spoke to the maid who was by the door, and she let Peter come in.
The maid at the door asked Peter, "Are you not one of the followers of that man?" He answered, "No."
Peter was warming himself along with the slaves of the chief habr and the guards. They stood around the burning coals, which they had lit since the weather was cold.
Then the chief habr interrogated Isa about his followers and his teaching.

metadata.item: Annas was a former chief habr, and he retained that title as an honor for life. See verse 24.

verse.content: Isa answered, "I have spoken to everyone in public, and my teaching was always in the houses of salat and the house of Allah. That is where Al-Yahud always meet. I have not hidden a word.
Why do you ask me? Ask the people who heard me. They know my words."
An officer standing next to him slapped him for his answer, and said, "Is that how you answer the chief habr?"
Isa answered, "If my answer is wrong, show me what is wrong. But if my answer is correct, why do you hit me?"
Then Ananias sent him bound to Caiaphas, the chief habr.
Simon Peter was standing with the other people who were warming themselves. They asked him, "Are you not one of the followers of that man?" Peter denied it, "No!"
One of the slaves of the chief habr, who was a relative of the man whose ear Peter had cut off, said, "Did I not see you in the orchard with him?"
Peter denied it again, and immediately, the rooster called.

Then they led Isa from Caiaphas to the house of the Roman governor after sunrise. But the Yahudi leaders did not enter the house of the governor, so that they would not become unclean. Otherwise, they could not eat the Passover Eid lamb.

metadata.item: They had conducted the previous questioning and trial at night, which was illegal for Bani Israil.
It is ironic that they did not think that killing an innocent man would make them unclean, but entering the house of a non-Yahudi would make them unclean.

verse.content: So the governor, Pilate, went out to them and asked them, "What do you accuse this man of doing?"
They answered him, "If he were not a criminal, we would not have delivered him to you."

metadata.item: It seems that the leaders of Al-Yahud had made a prior arrangement with Pilate, and they were upset when Pilate did not immediately execute their wishes. One possible reason is that the wife of Pilate had had a dream about Isa and warned Pilate not to kill him. See the Injil, Matthew 27:19.

verse.content: Pilate told them, "Take him and judge him according to your law." The Yahudi leaders answered him, "We have no authority to execute anyone."

metadata.item: Al-Yahud were under the Roman occupation of Palestine, and death sentences were approved by and executed by the Roman governor. Al-Yahud sometimes murdered people they did not like, but could not officially execute anyone. They threatened to kill Isa in this way several times by stoning, but did not do it. See 8:48 and 10:31.

verse.content: The word of Isa about how he would die was fulfilled in that way.

metadata.item: The Romans had invented crucifixion and used it for executions.

verse.content: Pilate returned to the house of the governor and summoned Isa. He asked him, "Are you the king of Al-Yahud?"
Isa answered, "Is that your question, or did other people tell you about me?"
Pilate answered, "Am I a Yahudi? Your people and the leading ahbar have delivered you to me. What did you do?"

metadata.item: Pilate was a Roman.

verse.content: Isa answered, "My kingdom is not of this world. If it were of this world, my supporters would fight for me so I would not be delivered to the Yahudi leaders. But my kingdom is not from here."

Pilate said to him, "So you are a king?" Isa answered, "You said it. I am a king. This is why I was born and entered this world: To give shahada to the truth. Everyone who is of the family of truth will respond to my voice."

metadata.item: The word family is obviously not literal. Here 'family of the truth' means people who follow the truth.

verse.content: Pilate said to him, "What is truth?" Then he went out to the Yahudi leaders again and told them, "I did not find any reason at all for accusing him.
You are accustomed that I release one prisoner for you at Passover Eid. Do you want me to release the king of Al-Yahud for you?"
They shouted, "Not this man but Barabbas." Barabbas was a thief.

metadata.item: He was also a murderer and a revolutionary. See Mark 15:7, Luke 23:17-18.

verse.content: Then Pilate took Isa and ordered for him to be whipped.
The soldiers wrapped thorns in the shape of a crown and put it on his head. Then they dressed him in a purple robe, the color of the clothing of kings.

metadata.item: They used long thorns to make a "crown" to mock him. Putting this on the head of Isa caused a lot of pain and bleeding.

verse.content: They started mocking him, "Long live the king of Al-Yahud!" Then they hit him on his face.
Pilate went out to Al-Yahud a second time and said, "I am bringing him out to you, so that you can know that I did not find any reason at all for accusing him."
Isa came out, crowned with thorns and wearing the purple robe. Pilate told them, "This is the man."
When the leading ahbar and officers saw him, they shouted, "Crucify him! Crucify him!" Pilate said to them, "Take him yourselves and crucify him! I did not find any reason for accusing him."

metadata.item: Pilate wanted to release him because he saw that Isa was innocent. See Acts of the Hawariyun 3:13.

verse.content: Al-Yahud answered him, "We have a law, and according to our law, this man deserves to die, because he made himself the beloved amir of Allah!"
Pilate became more afraid when he heard these words.

metadata.item: Pilate was a Roman, and the Romans believed in many gods, some of whom they thought were sons of other gods. Pilate may have thought that Isa was one of those, and the idea of killing someone who might be one of his gods made him afraid.

verse.content: Then he entered the house of the governor and questioned Isa, "Where did you come from?" But Isa did not answer him.
Pilate said to him, "Will you not answer me? Do you not know that I have the authority to release you or execute you by crucifying you?"
Isa answered him, "The only authority you have over me is from above. The person who delivered me to you has a greater sin."
That is why Pilate tried to release him. But the Yahudi leaders objected, "If you release this man, you are not a friend of Caesar! Everyone who claims to be a king is against Caesar!"

metadata.item: This was a threat to report Pilate to Caesar. Caesar was afraid of this.

verse.content: When he heard these words, Pilate brought Isa out and sat on the seat of judgment, near the place called the pavement (Gabbatha in Hebrew).
It was Friday, the day of preparation for the Passover Eid. It was early morning. He told the Yahudi leaders, "This is your king!"

metadata.item: Or possibly noon. In the original language, the sixth hour. In Roman time, this would be 6:00 a.m., and in the time used by Al-Yahud, noon.

verse.content: They shouted, "Get rid of him! Get rid of him! Crucify him!" Pilate asked them, "Shall I crucify your king?" The leading ahbar answered, "We have no king except Caesar!"
So he delivered him to them to be crucified, and they took him.
Isa went out, carrying his cross, to the hill called Golgotha in Hebrew. (This means place of the skull).
They crucified him there, with a criminal on both sides and Isa between them.
Pilate wrote a notice and attached it to the cross, saying, "Isa Al-Nasiri, king of Al-Yahud."
Many of Al-Yahud read it, because the place of the cross was near Al-Quds. The notice was in Hebrew, Latin, and Greek.
The leading ahbar of Al-Yahud objected and told Pilate, "Do not write 'King of Al-Yahud.' Rather, write 'He claimed to be king of Al-Yahud.'"
Pilate answered, "I wrote what I wrote."
After the soldiers had crucified Isa, they took his clothes and divided them into four portions among them. Each soldier got one portion. However, his robe was all one piece, with no seam.

They said to each other, "Why should we tear it? Let us throw lots to see who should get it." So what Allah had said in the Zabur was truly fulfilled: "They divided my clothing among them, and cast lots for my robe." So the soldiers did that.
His mother, the sister of his mother (Mariam the wife of Clopas), and Mariam Magdalene, were standing next to the cross.

metadata.item: The word sister is probably not literal. The word sister can include sister-in-law as well, and early historians say that the husband of this Mariam, Clopas, was a brother of Yusif (the husband of Mariam and the step-father of Isa). It is improbable that parents would name two different sisters the same name. So this Mariam was most probably the sister-in-law of Mariam, mother of Isa.

verse.content: When Isa saw his mother and the beloved hawari standing near him, he said, "Honored woman, this is your son!"

metadata.item: Almost certainly, Yahya the son of Zebedee.

verse.content: Then he said to the hawari, "This is your mother!" From that hour, the beloved hawari took her to his home.
After that, Isa knew that everything was completed. So he said, "I am thirsty." That fulfilled what Allah had revealed in the Zabur.

metadata.item: The Zabur, Psalms 22:15, 69:21.

verse.content: They dipped a sponge in a container of vinegar and raised it on a reed to his mouth.
He tasted the vinegar and said, "The matter is finished." Then he bowed his head and delivered his ruh.

metadata.item: Or, "Paid in full."
To Allah.

verse.content: This day was the day of preparation for the Eid. So Al-Yahud asked Pilate to break the legs of the people who were crucified and to take their bodies down before Al-Sabt. Otherwise, the eid would be unclean if they stayed on the crosses.

metadata.item: The Passover Eid was on Saturday that year.
When their legs were broken, the people who were crucified could no longer push themselves up and breathe, so they would die very quickly.

verse.content: The soldiers came and broke the legs of the two people who were crucified on the sides of Isa.
But they found that Isa was already dead, so they did not break his legs.
But one of the soldiers pierced his side with a spear, and blood and water came out immediately.

metadata.item: Possibly to make sure that he was dead.

verse.content: The person who saw his death gives shahada for this, and his shahada is true, certain, and factual. This is so that you also would be trusting believers.
This happened so that what Allah had revealed would be fulfilled, "They will not break any of his bones."

metadata.item: This is a reference to the Tawrat, Exodus 12:46, Numbers 9:12; and the Zabur, Psalms 34:20.

verse.content: It also fulfilled what is in the kitab, "They will look at the one they have pierced."

metadata.item: This is a quotation from the Tawrat, Zakariyya 12:10.

verse.content: Yusif of Arimathea was a follower of Isa in secret, because he was afraid of the Yahudi leaders. He went and asked Pilate if he could take the body of Isa. Pilate permitted him to do that, so he came and took it.
He and Nicodemus, who had visited him previously at night, came carrying the weight of a load of a mixture of myrrh and incense.

metadata.item: About 32 kilograms.
See the Injil, Matthew 2:11.

verse.content: They took the corpse of Isa and wrapped it with the spices in a linen cloth around his body. This was according to the custom of Al-Yahud for burial.
There was an orchard with a new grave near the place of the cross of Isa. No one had been put there before.

metadata.item: This grave belonged to Yusif of Arimathea. See Matthew 27:57-60.

verse.content: So they put Isa in it, because Friday was the day of preparation for Al-Yahud, and because the grave was near.

metadata.item: The day before Al-Sabt, which began at sunset Friday in a few hours.

verse.content: Mariam Magdalene came to the grave Sunday morning at dawn. She saw that the stone that had sealed the entrance to the grave had been rolled away from the grave.
So she went quickly to Simon Peter and the other hawari, the beloved of Isa, and told them, "They took the body of our mawla from the grave, and we do not know where they took it!"
So Peter and the other hawari hurried to the grave.
They were running together, but the other hawari arrived at the grave first.
He bent down and saw the cloth placed in the cave, but he did not enter it.
Then Simon Peter came behind him and entered the grave and saw the cloth placed there.
He also saw the napkin that they wrapped his head with, still wrapped and in another place.
Then the other hawari, who had arrived first, entered after him and saw that. Then he became a believer.
They did not yet understand what Allah had revealed in the kitab about the necessity of al-masih being resurrected alive from death.

metadata.item: This is a reference to several verses, including the Zabur, Psalms 16:10, and the Tawrat, Hosea 6:3.

verse.content: So the two hawariyun returned to the place they were staying.
But Mariam remained standing and crying outside the grave. While she was crying, she bent down to look inside the grave.
She saw two angels wearing white clothes. One was sitting where the head of Isa had been, and the other was sitting where his feet had been.
They asked her, "Woman, why are you crying?" She answered them, "They took the body of my mawla and I do not know where they took it."

metadata.item: This was her assumption.

verse.content: After that, she turned, and she saw Isa standing behind her. But she did not know that he was Isa.

Isa asked her, "Woman, why are you crying? What do you want?" She thought he was the keeper of the orchard, so she told him, "Sir, if you have carried the body to another place, tell me where he is. Then I can take him."
Isa told her, "Mariam." She turned to him and said in Hebrew, "Rabboni!" (This means honored teacher.)

He told her, "Do not grab me, because I have not yet been raised to my Most Loving King. But go and tell my brothers that I will be raised to my Most Loving King, who is also your Most Loving King. He is my Rabb and your Rabb."
So Mariam Magdalene went and told the hawariyun: "I have seen our mawla!" She told them what he had told her.

That evening, which was Sunday, the doors of the house where the hawariyun were hiding were closed because they were afraid of the Yahudi leaders. Isa came and stood in the middle of them. He said, "Assalamu Alaikum."
After that, he showed him his hands and his side. And the hawariyun were happy to see their mawla.
Isa repeated his saying, "Assalamu Alaikum. As the Most Loving King has sent me, I am sending you."
Then he breathed on them and said, "Receive Holy Ruh Allah.
If you pardon the sins of anyone, they are forgiven. If you make them remain, they remain."
Thomas, the hawari called the twin, was absent when Isa came.

The rest of the hawariyun told him, "We saw our mawla!" But Thomas did not believe them. He said, "I will never believe until I see the scars from the nails in his hands, and I put my finger in the scars, and put my hand in his side."
Eight days later, the hawariyun met again, and Thomas was with them. The doors were closed, and Isa came and stood in the middle of them. He said, "Assalamu Alaikum."
Then he said to Thomas, "Put your finger here, and look at my hands. Put your hand into my side. Be a believer, not a kafir."
Thomas answered him, "My mawla, my Rabb!"

metadata.item: See verse 17.

verse.content: Then Isa told him, "Have you believed because you saw me? Those who believe and who have not seen me have a baraka."
Isa did many ayat and miracles for the hawariyun in addition to the ones that are recorded in this scroll.
But these are recorded so that you can believe that Isa is the expected king, the mustafa of Allah. Then you can have life in his name if you believe.
After that, Isa showed himself again to the hawariyun on the shore of Tabaria Lake in this way:

metadata.item: This is in Al-Jalil. See Mark 16:7, Matthew 28:7

verse.content: Simon Peter, Thomas the twin, Nathaniel from Cana in Al-Jalil, the two sons of Zebedee and two other hawariyun met.
Simon Peter said, "I am going fishing." The rest said, "We are going with you." They went out and got in a boat, but they did not catch anything all night.
In the morning, Isa was standing on the shore, but the hawariyun did not realize that it was Isa.
Isa said to them, "My children, do you not have any fish?" They answered, "No, we do not."

metadata.item: The word children is not literal. Isa was never married and had no children. In addition, all the hawariyun were grown men. Isa said this to show compassion and love to them.

verse.content: He told them, "Throw the net on the right side of the boat, and you will find some." So they threw it, and they could not pull it back up because there were so many fish.

metadata.item: Isa knew what was hidden.

verse.content: The hawari, the beloved of Isa, told Peter, "It is our mawla." When Simon Peter heard that this was their mawla, he tied his robe, which he had taken off, around his waist, and threw himself into the lake.

metadata.item: Yahya the son of Zebedee.
He swam to the shore.

verse.content: Then the rest of the hawariyun followed him in the boat. They pulled the net full of fish behind them, because they were not far from the shore (about two hundred cubits).

metadata.item: About one hundred meters. A cubit is the distance from the elbow to the end of the fingers, usually about 45-50 cm.

verse.content: When they got out of the boat, they saw a charcoal fire, fish cooking on it, and bread.
Isa told them, "Bring me some of the fish that you caught."
Simon Peter went and pulled the net to the shore. There were one hundred fifty-three large fish. Despite that, the net was not torn.

metadata.item: Fishers generally count their fish.

verse.content: Then Isa told them, "Come to breakfast." None of the hawariyun were bold enough to ask him, "Who are you?" They knew it was their mawla.
Isa came, took the bread, and distributed it and the fish to them.
This was the third time that Isa showed himself to the hawariyun after the day he was resurrected alive from death.
After breakfast, Isa said to Simon Peter, "Simon son of Yahya, do you love me more than these?" He answered, "Yes, my mawla. You know that I like you." So Isa told him, "Feed my lambs."
He said to him again, "Simon son of Yahya, do you love me?" Simon told him, "Yes my mawla. You know that I like you." So Isa told him, "Take care of my sheep."

He said to him again, "Simon son of Yahya, do you like me?" Peter was sad that the third time, he said, "Do you like me?" He answered, "My mawla, you know everything. You know that I like you." So Isa told him, "Feed my sheep."

I tell you a true, true saying: When you were young, you put on your robe and walked where you wanted. But when you are old, you will stretch out your hands, and another person will dress you and take you where you do not want to go."
By this saying, Isa referred to the way Peter would die as a martyr on a cross to the majesty of the glory of Allah. Then Isa told him, "Follow me."
Peter turned and saw the hawari, the beloved of Isa, walking behind them. He was the one who reclined next to Isa and asked him, "My mawla, who is your betrayer?"

metadata.item: This event happened in chapter 13:21-26.

verse.content: When he saw him, Peter asked Isa, "My mawla, what is the destiny of this one?"
Isa told him, "If I will it that he remains alive until I come, what does that matter to you? You follow me!"
A rumor spread among the brothers that that hawari would never die. But Isa did not say that. Isa said, "If I will it that he remains alive until I come..."

metadata.item: The word brothers is not literal. Here it means believers.
Yahya son of Zebedee.

verse.content: This is the hawari who gives a true shahada about all of this. He is the one who recorded it in this scroll. His shahada is true, certain, and factual.
Isa did many other ayat and miracles. If all the ayat were recorded, I suppose the whole world would not be able to contain all the scrolls.

Dear Theophilus: In the first part, I recorded the beginning of all the works that Isa did and the beginning of his message, 1 until the day when Allah raised him to himself. That was after he issued his commands through Holy Ruh Allah to the hawariyun he had chosen.

metadata.item: Theophilus may be a title, not a name. The name means "A person who loves Allah."
This scroll was written by Luke, and is a continuation of the book of Luke.
The verse numbers come at the end of the verse.

verse.content: After his sufferings and death, he showed them with many clear proofs that he was alive. He appeared to them for forty days and spoke to them about the kingdom of Allah.
While he was present with them, he commanded them, "Do not leave Al-Quds. Wait for the fulfillment of the promise of the Most Loving King as you heard from me.

metadata.item: The promise referred to here was giving Holy Ruh Allah to live in the trusting believers.

This refers to the Arabic names Al-Malik and Al-Wadud, two of the 99 names of Allah. Isa used this title to describe his unique relationship with Allah. Isa called him his Most Loving King, with Isa as his amir. See glossary for more information.

verse.content: Yahya did ghusl for people into water for repentance, but you will receive ghusl into Holy Ruh Allah after a few days."
Then they gathered around him and asked him, "Our mawla, will you now restore the kingdom to Bani Israil?"

metadata.item: Isa had talked many times about the kingdom of Allah, but the hawariyun misunderstood his meaning. They thought his kingdom would be an earthly kingdom, but Isa was talking about a spiritual kingdom. See Yahya 18:33-37.

verse.content: He told them, "You are not allowed to know the dates and ages that the Most Loving King has specified by his power.
But Allah will support you with power when Holy Ruh Allah comes down upon you. Then you will give shahada to me in Al-Quds, in all Yahudia and Samaria, and to the ends of the inhabited world."
After he said that, Allah raised him to himself. They were watching, and he disappeared from their sight in the clouds.
They remained and stared at the sky while he was taken up, and suddenly two men wearing white clothing appeared.
They said to the hawariyun, "Why are you men from Al-Jalil staring at the sky? Isa was raised from you into heaven. And he will return down in the same way as he ascended into heaven."
So they traveled back to Al-Quds from Jabal Zaytun. It was near, about the distance allowed for travel on Al-Sabt.

When they entered the city, they went to the house where they were staying, on the upper floor. They were Peter, Yahya, Yacoub, Andrew, Philip, Thomas, Bartholomew, Matthew, Yacoub son of Alphaeus, Simon the Zealot, and Yahuda son of Yacoub.

metadata.item: The upper floor of the houses was often used for a guest room.

verse.content: They all continued to pray in dua' with one will, along with some women, Mariam Um Isa, and the brothers of Isa.
In those days, Peter stood among the brothers who were gathered, who numbered about one hundred twenty. He spoke to them,

metadata.item: The word brothers is not literal. Here and in the next verse, it means believers.

verse.content: "My brothers, what Holy Ruh Allah revealed by the tongue of Dawood about Yahuda had to be fulfilled. He caused the arrest of Isa.

metadata.item: Yahuda Iscariot.

verse.content: Yahuda was one of us, and he shared in our message.
Yahuda bought a field with the price of his treachery. Then he fell on his face and his abdomen split open and his intestines poured out.
All the inhabitants of Al-Quds knew about that, so they called the field in their language 'Haqel Damakh', or the field of blood.
This happened to fulfill what was in the Zabur, 'May his residence be deserted, with no one living in it,' and 'Let someone else take his position.'

metadata.item: This is a quotation from the Zabur, Psalms 69:25.
This is a quotation from the Zabur, Psalms 109:8.

verse.content: Therefore, we must choose one of the men who accompanied us for all the time our mawla Isa remained among us,
starting from when Yahya did ghusl for him until the day Allah raised him up from us. This man must give shahada with us to the resurrection of Isa alive."
Two men were suggested: Yusif Barsabas, who was called just, and Matthias.
Everyone asked Allah for guidance. They said, "Our Rabb, you are All-knowing of the hearts of all people. Show us the man you have chosen

metadata.item: This refers to the Arabic name Al-Alim, one of the 99 names of Allah.

verse.content: to be a servant and to be sent in place of Yahuda, who went astray from al-sirat and received his fate."
So they chose Matthias by lot, and he joined the eleven hawariyun.
When the day of Pentecost Eid came, they were all gathered in one place.

metadata.item: This eid was 50 days after the Passover Eid.

verse.content: Suddenly, a sound like a stormy wind came from heaven. It filled the parts of the house they were in,
and tongues in the form of fire appeared to them.

The tongues were distributed to each one of them, and they remained on them. So they were all filled with Holy Ruh Allah, and they started speaking with languages that were not their own, as the Ruh made possible.
Righteous men from all the nations of this world were staying in Al-Quds.

metadata.item: They followed the Yahudi religion and had moved to Al-Quds.

verse.content: At this sound, the multitudes were puzzled, and gathered. Each one of them heard a speech in his own language.
They were all amazed, and they asked each other, "Are not all of these speakers from Al-Jalil?

metadata.item: Al-Jalil was considered an uneducated place, where foreign languages would not be known.

verse.content: How does each one of us hear them speaking in his own native language?
We are Parthians, Medes, Elamites, Mesopotamians, people from Yahudia, Cappadocia, Pontus, Asia Minor,
Phrygia, Pamphylia, Egypt, parts of Libya near Cyrene, and Rome, both from Al-Yahud and converts to the Yahudi religion,
in addition to Cretans, and Arabs. We hear a speech about the great ayat of Allah from them in our own languages!"
They were amazed and confused, and they started asking each other, "What does this mean?"
Another group of people mocked them, and said, "They are drunk!"
But Peter stood, along with the eleven other hawariyun, and spoke to them with a loud voice. He said, "People from Yahudia and everyone staying in Al-Quds, listen to my words, and know this.
These men are not drunk, as you suppose. It is only nine o'clock in the morning!

metadata.item: In the original, the third hour. Even if people were drinking, nine o'clock in the morning was too early to be drunk.

verse.content: Rather, this is a confirmation of what Allah revealed by the tongue of the nabi Joel:
'Allah said: in the last days, I will make my Ruh overflow onto all people. Your sons and your daughters will speak prophecies. Your young men will see visions, and your old men will have dreams.
In those days, I will even make my Ruh overflow on my slaves, both men and women, and they will give prophecies.
I will do miracles in the sky above and ayat on the earth below: blood, fire, and smoke.
The sun will become dark, and the moon will become blood before the day of Rabb Al-Alamin comes. That day is great and glorious.

metadata.item: This had happened when Isa was on the cross.
The moon rose in eclipse (and so was reddish colored) the evening after Isa died on the cross.

verse.content: Then, everyone who seeks help from the name of Rabb Al-Alamin will be saved.'

metadata.item: This is a quotation from the Tawrat, Joel 2:28-32.

verse.content: Bani Israil, listen to these words: Isa Al-Nasiri was a man supported by Allah in truth. He was sealed with works of power, wonders, and definitive ayat, which he did by the power of Allah, as you know.
You delivered Isa by the predestined will and eternal knowledge of Allah, and you crucified and killed him by the hands of unjust people.

metadata.item: This is a reference to the Zabur, Psalms 22. Al-Yahud delivered Isa to the Romans.

verse.content: But Allah resurrected him alive and freed him from death, because death had no power to hold him.

metadata.item: This was because Isa never sinned or disobeyed Allah.

verse.content: As Allah inspired Dawood: 'I saw Al-Mawla in front of me always. He is on my right side, so that I will not be shaken.
Therefore, my heart is joyful and my tongue speaks the praise of Allah. Even my body will live in certain hope.
You will not leave my soul as a captive of death in the grave. You will not allow the body of your holy rasul to decay.
You guided me on the sirat of life, and in your presence you will fill me with joy.'

metadata.item: This is a quotation from the Zabur, Psalms 16:8-11.

verse.content: Brothers, I confirm to you with certainty that our father Dawood died and was buried. His grave is still here today!
He was a nabi, and he knew the promise that Allah had sworn to him: One of his descendants would sit on his throne as king.
Dawood saw in advance the resurrection of the king al-masih, and he prophesied that he would not be left in the grave and his body would not decay in the grave.

metadata.item: Al-masih.

verse.content: And truly Allah resurrected Isa alive, and we all give shahada to that.
He was raised to Allah, highly exalted at his right hand. So he received promised Holy Ruh Allah from the Most Gracious King, and made him overflow on us as you have seen and heard today.

metadata.item: The right side of a king was the position of his deputy, prime minister, or regent.

verse.content: Dawood did not ascend to heaven, but he said in the Zabur: Allah said to my mawla: Sit at my right hand
until I put your enemies under your feet.

metadata.item: This is a quotation from the Zabur, Psalms 110:1.

verse.content: So let all Bani Israil know for certain that Allah has made Isa, whom you crucified, mawla and masih king."
When the people heard this, everyone felt guilty in the depths of their hearts. They asked Peter and the rest of the hawariyun, "Brothers, what should we do?"

metadata.item: The word brother is not literal. Here it means fellow Yahud.

verse.content: Peter answered them, "Every one of you should repent and do ghusl into the name of Isa al-masih. Then Allah will relent, forgive your sins, and give you promised Holy Ruh Allah.
The promise is for you, your children, and everyone who is far away. This is a promise to everyone Allah our Mawla calls."

metadata.item: Anyone, near or far, who repents, trusts in Isa and follows him will receive Holy Ruh Allah.

verse.content: Peter gave shahada to them with many other words and warned them. He said, "Be saved from this rebellious generation!"

metadata.item: The generation of Yahud who had called for Isa to be killed was guilty of delivering Isa to the Romans to be killed, and they had taken that guilt upon themselves. See Matthew 27:25.

verse.content: The people who received the words of Peter did ghusl, and that day three thousand people joined the umma of the followers of Isa.
They continued hearing the teaching of the hawariyun, sharing like brothers, breaking bread and praying in dua'.
The hearts of everyone were filled with fear, and the hawariyun did many ayat and miracles.
All the believers were united and shared everything they owned.
They continued to sell their lands and their possessions and distributed the price to everyone, according to the need of each one.

metadata.item: During this intensive time of training, the new followers of Isa may not have been working regular jobs, so those who had property sold it and shared the money with others.

verse.content: They attended the house of Allah daily with one will, and broke bread from house to house. They shared food together with joyful, humble hearts.
They praised Allah, and all the people had rida toward them. Al-Mawla daily caused more people who were given saving mercy to join the number of the believers.
One day, Peter and Yahya were going to the house of Allah at the time of afternoon salat.

metadata.item: This was about 3:00 p.m.

verse.content: Some people were carrying a man who was born paralyzed. Every day they put him at the gate of the house of Allah called "Beautiful" so he could beg for alms from the people who were entering the courtyard of the house of Allah.
When he saw Peter and Yahya entering the house of Allah, he begged alms from them.
Peter and Yahya stared at him and Peter said, "Look at us."
The beggar noticed them and expected to get something from them.
But Peter said, "I do not have silver or gold. But I give you what I have. In the name of Isa al-masih Al-Nasiri, walk!"
Peter grasped his right hand and raised him. Immediately, the feet and ankles of the man became strong.
He jumped up, stood, and started walking. He entered with them into the house of Allah, walking, jumping, and praising Allah.
The people saw him walking and praising Allah,
and they knew that he was the beggar who was always sitting by the door called "Beautiful." So they were amazed and puzzled at what had happened.
The man stayed close to Peter and Yahya, and the people from the corridor of Sulayman were amazed, and hurried to them.
Peter saw that and spoke to the people, "Bani Israil, why are you amazed at this? Why are you staring at us as if we made him walk by our power or piety?

Allah, the Rabb of Ibrahim, the Rabb of Ishaq, the Rabb of Yacoub, and the Rabb of our fathers, has shown the majesty of the glory of his slave Isa. You delivered and denied Isa to Pilate, asking for his execution after Pilate had decided to release him.

metadata.item: The word fathers is not literal. Here it means ancestors.

verse.content: You denied holy, righteous Isa and asked for the release of a murderer.
You killed the giver of life, but Allah resurrected him alive from death, and we give shahada to that!
By trusting in the name of Isa, his name has given this paralyzed man strength, as you see and know. By trusting in Isa, he has given him this health and wellness in front of you all.
Now, brothers, I know that you and your leaders committed this crime ignorantly.

metadata.item: The word brothers is not literal. Here it means people who share the same religion or faith.

verse.content: But by that, Allah fulfilled what he revealed beforehand by the tongues of all the anbiya about the sufferings of al-masih, whom he sent.
So repent and return to your Rabb. Then Allah will wipe away your sins,
and times of relief will come to you from Rabb Al-Alamin. Then Allah will send you your king Isa, the expected al-masih, whom he has appointed for you.
He must remain in heaven until the time of restoring everything to its proper place. This is what he has said by the mouth of his holy anbiya since ancient times.
He told Musa about it in the Tawrat, saying, "Allah your Mawla will raise a nabi like me for you from among your brothers. Obey everything he tells you.

metadata.item: This refers to Isa.
The word brothers is not literal. Here and elsewhere in the Tawrat, it means other people of Bani Israil. It was necessary that this nabi, al-masih, would come from Bani Israil.

verse.content: Whoever does not obey this nabi will be totally excluded from the people and be destroyed.

metadata.item: This is a quotation from the Tawrat, Deuteronomy 18:18-19.

verse.content: All the anbiya announced these days in their scrolls, starting from Samuel.
And you are the sons of the anbiya and heirs of the covenant that Allah made with our fathers, when he said to Ibrahim, 'I will bless all the families of the earth through your seed.'

metadata.item: The word sons is not literal. Here it means people who claim to follow the anbiya.
The word fathers is not literal. Here it means ancestors.
This is a reference to the Tawrat, Genesis 22:18 and 12:3.

verse.content: Allah raised his slave and sent him to you first to bless you by each one of you turning back from his sins.

metadata.item: Isa.

verse.content: As Peter and Yahya were talking to the people, the ahbar, the captain of the guards of the house of Allah, and the Sadducees came to them.
They were annoyed because they were teaching the people and announcing the resurrection of dead people through Isa.

metadata.item: The Sadducees were responsible for the temple and they had not authorized Peter and Yahya to teach.
The Sadducees did not believe in the resurrection of dead people.

verse.content: So they arrested them and put them in jail until the next day, because it was late afternoon.
But many people who heard their message trusted in Isa, and the number of the believing men reached five thousand.
The leaders of Al-Yahud and their elders and fuqaha met in Al-Quds the next day,
with Annas the chief habr, Caiaphas, Yahya, Alexander, and all the relatives of the chief habr.

metadata.item: This is not Yahya Bin Zakariya or Yahya the hawari.

verse.content: They made Peter and Yahya stand in the middle of them, and they asked them, "In whose power or in whose name did you do that?"
Peter was filled with Holy Ruh Allah, and answered them, "Leaders and elders of the people.
You are questioning us today about a good deed toward a paralyzed man, and you want to know how he was healed.

All of you and all the people of Bani Israil must know that it was in the name of Isa al-masih Al-Nasiri, whom you crucified, whom Allah resurrected alive from death. In his name this man stands in front of you with a whole body.
Isa is the rock that you builders rejected and despised. He has become the top stone of the building.
There is no salvation except through him. There is no other name under heaven besides his name that Allah has given to people through which we must be saved."
They were amazed when they noticed the boldness of Peter and Yahya, since they knew that the two men were uneducated, uncultured men. And they realized that they had been with Isa.

metadata.item: They had not received formal education in the Yahudi religious schools, but had learned from Isa and from Holy Ruh Allah.

verse.content: But they were not able to object to anything, since they saw the paralyzed man who had been healed standing beside them.
They ordered them to be sent outside of the council so they could discuss this matter among themselves.
They said, "What can we do with these two men? It is known that they have done a great ayah in the sight of all the residents of Al-Quds. We cannot deny this ayah.
So let us threaten them never to speak about this name to anyone, so that the news of the ayah will not spread further among the people."
So they brought them back and commanded them not to speak or teach any more in the name of Isa.
But Peter and Yahya said in response, "Is it right with Allah to obey your words instead of the words of Allah? You judge that!
We cannot be silent about what we have seen and heard!"
Then they threatened them again, and released them. They did not find any way to punish them because they were afraid of the people. Everyone was praising the glory of Allah for what had happened.
For the paralyzed man who had been healed by the ayah was more than forty years old.
When they were released, Peter and Yahya went to their brothers and told them what the leading ahbar and the elders of the people had said.

metadata.item: The word brothers is not literal. Here it means fellow believers or fellow hawariyun.

verse.content: So they prayed in dua' to Allah, united in will, "Our Rabb, Creator of the heavens, the earth, the sea, and everything in it, Allahumma, you revealed through your Holy Ruh by the tongue of our father Dawood what you said in the Zabur: 'Why are the nations shaking and the peoples plotting in vain?
The kings of the earth have lined up, and the rulers have gathered against Rabb Al-Alamin and his masih.'

metadata.item: This is a quotation from the Zabur, Psalms 2:1-2.

verse.content: Truly king Herod, the governor Pilate, other nations, and Bani Israil have met in this city and plotted against your sinless holy slave Isa, whom you have chosen.
They fulfilled what your hand had planned and predestined since eternity past.
Our Rabb, now pay them back for their threats and aid your slaves with all courage, so that we can speak your word.
Stretch out your hand in healing to show ayat and miracles in the name of your sinless holy slave Isa."
After they had finished praying in dua', the place where they were gathered shook. They were all filled with Holy Ruh Allah. They began to speak the word of Allah with courage.
The umma of believers were united in heart and soul. And none of them said that his possessions were his. They shared in everything.
The hawariyun gave their shahada with great power about the resurrection of our mawla Isa al-masih, and great baraka from Allah was on all of them.
There was no needy person among them, because owners of lands or houses sold what they owned and brought the proceeds.
They placed it at the feet of the hawariyun, who distributed it to everyone according to his needs.
Yusif, whom the hawariyun called Barnabas, was one of the people who did this. (The name Barnabas means son of encouragement.) He was a Levite from Cyprus.

metadata.item: This is not Yusif the husband of Mariam or Yusif son of Yacoub. Yusif was a common name.

verse.content: He sold a field he owned, brought the money, and put it at the feet of the hawariyun.
A man named Ananias and his wife Sapphira sold a property.

metadata.item: This is not Ananias the chief habr.

verse.content: He kept a part of the price for himself and his wife knew this. Then he put only a portion of the price at the feet of the hawariyun.

metadata.item: He pretended that he was giving the whole price.

verse.content: And Peter said, "Ananias, why did Al-Shaitan fill your heart so that you lied to Holy Ruh Allah and kept part of the price of the land?
The property was yours, and even when you sold it, you could have kept control of the money. How did you invent this shameful matter in your heart? You did not lie to people, but to Allah!"
When he heard these words, Ananias fell dead. Everyone who heard this news was very afraid.
Young men wrapped him in a grave cloth, carried him out, and buried him.
After about three hours, his wife came in. She did not know what had happened.
Peter asked her, "Tell me, was the price of the property this much?" She said, "Yes, that much."
Peter told her, "What made you lie to the Ruh of Allah Al-Mawla? Look! The feet of the people who buried your husband are at the door. They will carry you out also."
And she fell dead at his feet immediately. The young men entered, found her dead, carried her outside, and buried her beside her husband.
Great fear came upon the whole umma of chosen people and everyone else who heard of their news.
The hawariyun did many miracles and ayat in the sight of the people. They gathered with one will in the corridor of Sulayman in the house of Allah.
The other people did not associate with them, but the people respected them in awe.
Numerous multitudes of male and female believers were added to the followers of our mawla Isa.
People carried their sick people and put them on mats and beds on the road so that even the shadow of Peter might fall on some of them as he passed.

metadata.item: They trusted that his shadow would give them baraka and healing.

verse.content: Crowds of people from the vicinity of Al-Quds brought their sick people and people touched by unclean spirits, and they were all healed.
But the chief habr and all the Sadducees with him stood up, filled with jealousy.
They arrested the hawariyun and put them in the common jail.
But Rabb Al-Alamin sent his angel at night, who opened the doors of the jail and freed them. He told them,
"Go and stand in the house of Allah, and tell the people the complete message about this spiritual life."

They obeyed his words, entered the courtyard of the house of Allah at sunrise, and started teaching. Then the chief habr and the rest of the people who were with him called a meeting of the highest council with all the elders of Bani Israil. Then they commanded the hawariyun to be brought from the jail.
But the police did not find the hawariyun in jail, so they returned and told them,
"We found the jail completely locked and the guards standing at the doors, but when we opened the doors, we did not find anyone inside."
When the officer of the police of the house of Allah and the leading ahbar heard their report, they were amazed. They asked each other about what this matter meant.
Then a man came and told them, "The men whom you put in jail are standing and teaching the people in the house of Allah."
The officer of the police went and brought them without violence, because they were afraid that the people would stone them.
Then they made them stand before the council, and the chief habr started to question them. He said,
"We commanded you strongly not to teach in this name, and you have filled Al-Quds with your teaching, insisting on casting the responsibility of the blood of this man on us!
Peter and the hawariyun answered him, "We must obey Allah and not people.
The Rabb of our fathers has resurrected Isa alive after you arrested him and delivered him to be executed by hanging him on a tree.

metadata.item: The word fathers is not literal. Here it means ancestors.

verse.content: But Allah raised him up, highly exalted at his right hand, as amir and savior, to give Bani Israil repentance and forgiveness of their sins.
We give shahada to these things, and so does Holy Ruh Allah, whom Allah sent down on those who obey him."

metadata.item: By this they implied that the council members did not obey Allah.

verse.content: When they heard this, they were furious. They wanted to kill the hawariyun.

But Gamaliel, one of the members of the highest council, stood up. He was a teacher of the Tawrat of the party of the Pharisees, and all the people respected him. He commanded that the hawariyun be put outside for a while.
Then he told the council, "Bani Israil, be careful what you do to these men.
Remember how Theudas came previously and claimed to be important. Four hundred men followed him. But after he was killed, his men were all scattered, and nothing resulted from it.
And remember how Yahuda from Al-Jalil came in the days of the census and stirred up the people after him. Then he also was killed and all his followers were scattered.

metadata.item: This is not one of the Yahudas who were hawariyun.
