verse.content: So I tell you in this matter, let these men go. Leave them alone. If this plan or movement is from people, it will fail.
But if it is from Allah, you will not be able to conquer them. You may find yourselves resisting Allah."
He convinced them, so they brought the hawariyun in. They whipped them, commanded them not to speak in the name of Isa, and then released them.
The hawariyun left the council rejoicing that Allah considered them worthy of the honor of bearing shame for the sake of the name of Isa.
Every day they were in the house of Allah and in the houses of people. They continued teaching and announcing the good news that the expected al-masih was Isa.

In those days, the number of the followers was increasing. The Yahudi believers who spoke Greek complained against the believers who spoke Hebrew, because their widows were not getting their share of food during the daily distribution.
The hawariyun called the group of the followers together and said, "It is not appropriate for us to neglect teaching the word of Allah in order to distribute food.
Brothers, choose seven honorable men among you who are filled with Ruh Allah and with wisdom. We will appoint them to be responsible for this matter.

metadata.item: The word brothers here is not literal. Here it means fellow believers.

verse.content: Then we can devote all our time to praying in dua' and teaching the word of Allah."

The whole group had rida about the decision of the hawariyun, and they chose Stephen, a man filled with Holy Ruh Allah and strong in trust. They also chose Philip, Prochurus, Nicanor, Timonas, Parmenas, and Nicolas, who was a convert to the Yahudi religion from Antioch.
They came with them in front of the hawariyun, who prayed in dua' for them and appointed them by putting their hands on them.
The word of Allah spread, and the number of followers increased greatly in Al-Quds. Many of the ahbar became obedient believers.
Stephen was filled with grace and power from Allah, and he did miracles and great ayat among the people.
Some Yahud from 'The Freed Slaves' house of salat, along with people from Cyrene, Alexandria, Cilicia, and Asia Minor argued with him.
But they could not resist his wisdom and the words that Ruh Allah inspired to him.
They stirred up some liars against him to give false shahada, "We heard him say kufr about Musa and Allah."
They stirred up the Yahudi people, their elders and the fuqaha against him, so they arrested Stephen and brought him to the highest council.
Then they brought people who gave false shahada. They said, "This man does not stop insulting the holy house and the Tawrat.
We heard him say that Isa Al-Nasiri will destroy the house of Allah and change the sunan that we inherited from Musa."
The people sitting in the council looked at the face of Stephen, and they saw that his face was like the face of an angel.
The chief habr asked him, "Are these accusations true?"
Stephen answered him, "My brothers and fathers, listen to me. Glorious Allah appeared to our father Ibrahim when he was living in Mesopotamia, before he lived in Haran.

metadata.item: The word brothers here is not literal. Here it means fellow Yahud.
The word father here is not literal, either. Here it means leaders of my people.
See the Zabur, Psalms 29:3.
The word father here is not literal. Here it means ancestor.
See the Tawrat, Genesis 11:31.

verse.content: He commanded him, 'Leave your land and your tribe, and go to the land that I will show you.'
So he left the land of the Chaldeans and lived in Haran. Then after the death of his father, Allah brought him into this land, where you are living.

metadata.item: See the Tawrat, Genesis 12:1-5.

verse.content: But he did not give him even enough land to stand on. Allah promised to give him the land as an inheritance for him and for his seed after him, even though he did not have a son yet.

metadata.item: Or descendant or descendants.
See the Tawrat, Genesis 12:7, 13:15, 15:18.

verse.content: Allah told him that his seed would be strangers in a strange land, and would be demeaned and enslaved for four hundred years.

metadata.item: Or descendants.
See the Tawrat, Genesis 15:13.

verse.content: Allah said: 'I will condemn the nation that makes them slaves, and then they will go out and worship me in this place.'

metadata.item: See the Tawrat, Genesis 15:14.

verse.content: Allah gave Ibrahim a covenant whose sign was circumcision. Then Ibrahim fathered Ishaq and circumcised him after eight days. Then Ishaq fathered Yacoub, and Yacoub fathered twelve sons, who became the fathers of the twelve tribes of Bani Israil.

metadata.item: See the Tawrat, Genesis 17:10-14.
See the Tawrat, Genesis 21:3-4.
See the Tawrat, Genesis 25:26.
See the Tawrat, Genesis 29:32 to 30:24, 35:17-18.

verse.content: Those fathers were jealous of their brother Yusif, and they sold him as a slave to Egypt. But Allah aided him

metadata.item: See the Tawrat, Genesis 37:1-4.
See the Tawrat, Genesis 37:25-28.
See the Tawrat, Genesis 39:2-3,21-23.

verse.content: and rescued him from all his difficulties. He gave him wisdom and good acceptance in front of Pharaoh, king of Egypt, who made him a ruler over Egypt and the person responsible for the royal family.

metadata.item: See the Tawrat, Genesis 41:14.
See the Tawrat, Genesis 41:15-39.
See the Tawrat, Genesis 41:40-41.

verse.content: All Egypt and Canaan were afflicted with a great famine and suffering, and our fathers did not find food.

metadata.item: See the Tawrat, Genesis 41:54.
See the Tawrat, Genesis 42:1.

verse.content: But Yacoub heard that there was wheat in Egypt, so he sent his sons there on the first trip.

metadata.item: See the Tawrat, Genesis 42:2.
See the Tawrat, Genesis 42:3.

verse.content: But on their second trip, Yusif showed himself to his brothers, and told Pharaoh about his family.

metadata.item: See the Tawrat, Genesis 43:2 to 45:4.
See the Tawrat, Genesis 45:16.

verse.content: So he called his father Yacoub and his family to come to him. They were seventy-five persons.

metadata.item: See the Tawrat, Genesis 45:17-25.

In the Tawrat, Genesis 46:8-27, it mentions 70 who came to Egypt and 66 who were direct descendants, not including wives. 70 includes Yusif, his two sons, and his father Yacoub and 66 does not. 75 includes the 66 plus the 9 living wives of the sons of Yacoub.

verse.content: So Yacoub went to Egypt, where he and later our fathers died.

metadata.item: See the Tawrat, Genesis 46:29.
See the Tawrat, Exodus 1:6.

verse.content: Their bodies were later taken to Shechem in Palestine, and buried in the grave that Ibrahim had bought for a sum of silver from the sons of Hamor in Shechem.

metadata.item: See the Tawrat, Genesis 49:29 to 50:13.
See the Tawrat, Genesis 33:19.

verse.content: The time for the fulfillment of the promise of Allah to Ibrahim was close, and Bani Israil multiplied in Egypt.

metadata.item: See the Tawrat, Exodus 1:7.

verse.content: Then another king took the throne of Egypt, and he knew nothing about Yusif.

metadata.item: See the Tawrat, Exodus 1:8.

verse.content: He is the one who dealt craftily with our people and afflicted our fathers unjustly. He made them abandon their newborn boys so that they would die.

metadata.item: See the Tawrat, Exodus 1:10.
See the Tawrat, Exodus 1:15-22.

verse.content: At that time, Musa was born, and he was beautiful to Allah. He was brought up for three months in the house of his father.

metadata.item: See the Tawrat, Exodus 2:1-2.
See the Tawrat, Exodus 2:2.

verse.content: Then his family was forced to abandon him, but the daughter of Pharaoh adopted him and raised him.

metadata.item: See the Tawrat, Exodus 2:3.
See the Tawrat, Exodus 2:5-10.

verse.content: Musa received all the wisdom of the Egyptians, and he was mighty in speaking and in action.
When he was forty years old, he decided to visit his brothers, Bani Israil.

metadata.item: As the context indicates, the word brothers is not literal. Here it means fellow members of Bani Israil.

verse.content: He saw an Egyptian mistreating a Yahudi, and he defended the wronged man and took revenge on the Egyptian and killed him.

metadata.item: See the Tawrat, Exodus 2:11.

verse.content: He thought that his brothers would understand that Allah was saving and rescuing them by his hand. But they did not understand this.
The next day, Musa came to two Yahud who were fighting. He tried to reconcile them. He said, 'Men, you are brothers. Why do you mistreat each other?'

metadata.item: The word brothers is not literal. Here it means fellow Yahud.
See the Tawrat, Exodus 2:13.

verse.content: But the unjust person pushed Musa aside from him. He said, 'Who made you a ruler and a judge over us?
Do you want to kill me like you killed the Egyptian yesterday?'

metadata.item: See the Tawrat, Exodus 2:14.

verse.content: At these words, Musa fled and emigrated, settling in the land of Midian as a stranger. There he got married and had two sons.

metadata.item: See the Tawrat, Exodus 2:15.
See the Tawrat, Exodus 2:21.
See the Tawrat, Exodus 2:22, 18:3-4, 1 Chronicles 23:15.

verse.content: After forty years, Allah sent an angel to the wilderness of Mount Sinai, who appeared in a flame of fire in a burning bush.

metadata.item: See verse 22 and the Tawrat, Exodus 7:7.
See the Tawrat, Exodus 3:2.

verse.content: Musa was amazed when he saw that sight, and he approached it to investigate the matter. A voice from Rabb Al-Alamin called him,

metadata.item: See the Tawrat, Exodus 3:3.

verse.content: 'I am Allah, the Rabb of your fathers, the Rabb of Ibrahim, Ishaq and Yacoub.' So Musa was afraid. He did not dare to look.

metadata.item: The word fathers is not literal. Here it means ancestors, especially Ibrahim, Ishaq, and Yacoub. These ancestors of Musa lived 4-5 centuries before Musa.
See the Tawrat, Exodus 3:6.

verse.content: Then Rabb Al-Alamin commanded him, 'Take off your shoes from your feet. The place you are standing is holy ground.
I have seen the suffering of my people in Egypt. I have heard their groaning. I have compassion on them and have come to rescue them. Come I will make you my rasul to Egypt.'

metadata.item: See the Tawrat, Exodus 3:7.
See the Tawrat, Exodus 3:8.
See the Tawrat, Exodus 3:10.

verse.content: Allah sent this Musa, whom they rejected, saying, 'Who made you a ruler or judge over us?' Allah made him a ruler and savior, and the angel who appeared to him in the bush aided him.

metadata.item: See the Tawrat, Exodus 3:10-12.

verse.content: He is the one who led Bani Israil out, and who did ayat and miracles in Egypt, at the Red Sea, and in the wilderness for forty years.

metadata.item: See the Tawrat, Exodus 14:20-21.
See the Tawrat, Exodus 7-12.
See the Tawrat, Exodus 14:13-28.

verse.content: This Musa is the one who told Bani Israil: 'Allah will raise up for you a nabi like me from among your brothers.'

metadata.item: See the Tawrat, Deuteronomy 18:15. The word brothers here is not literal. Here it means fellow Yahud, as shown in the context of the Tawrat, Deuteronomy 17:15, where brothers clearly refers to fellow Yahud. Here and in the Injil, Acts of the Hawariyun 3:22, it is clear that this was a prophecy about Isa.

verse.content: He was the one who was with our fathers and the umma of Bani Israil in the wilderness when the angel called him at Mount Sinai. And Allah revealed his living book to him to pass on to them.

metadata.item: See the Tawrat, Exodus 19:17-25.
See the Tawrat, Exodus 31:18.

verse.content: But our fathers disobeyed him and rejected him. Their hearts turned to Egypt.

metadata.item: The word fathers is not literal. Here it means ancestors.

verse.content: They asked Harun: 'Make us idols to go before us. We do not know what happened to this Musa, who brought us from the land of Egypt.'

metadata.item: See the Tawrat, Exodus 32:1.

verse.content: In those days, they made an idol in the form of an ox. Then they sacrificed sacrifices to it, joyful at what their hands had done.

metadata.item: See the Tawrat, Exodus 32:4.
See the Tawrat, Exodus 32:6.

verse.content: So Allah turned away from them, and left them in their polytheism. They worshipped the stars, as it says in the scroll of the prophets, 'Family of Bani Israil, did you present sacrifices and qarabin to me in the wilderness for forty years?

No! You carried the tent for worshiping the idol Molech and the star Riphan you worshiped with you. They are two idols you made with your hands to bow down to them. Therefore I will throw you beyond Babylon.'

metadata.item: This is a quotation from the Tawrat, Amos 5:25-27.

verse.content: The tent of the shahada was with our fathers in the wilderness. This was the tent that Allah commanded Musa to make according to pattern that he saw.

metadata.item: See the Tawrat, Exodus 40:33-38.
See the Tawrat, Exodus 25:9.

verse.content: Our fathers received it as a possession until they brought it into Palestine with Joshua son of Nun, when Allah cast out the polytheistic Canaanite nations in front of them. The tent remained until the era of Dawood,

metadata.item: See the Tawrat, Joshua 3.
See the Tawrat, Joshua 23:3.
See the Tawrat, 1 Chronicles 6:31-32.

verse.content: whom Allah had rida toward. He prayed in dua' to Allah that he could find a dwelling for the family of Yacoub.

metadata.item: See the Tawrat, 2 Samuel 7:1-13.

verse.content: But his son Sulayman was the one who built it.

metadata.item: See the Tawrat, 1 Kings 16:1-38.

verse.content: But Allah the Most High does not live in houses built by the hands of people. This is as Allah revealed by the tongue of the nabi:

metadata.item: This refers to the Arabic name Al-Aliy, one of the 99 names of Allah.

verse.content: 'Allah said: My throne is heaven, and the earth is under my feet. How can you build me a place for me to stay?
Am I not the Creator of heaven and earth?'

metadata.item: This is a quotation from the Tawrat, Shaya 66:1-2.

verse.content: You are a stubborn people with unpurified hearts and ears? You always resist Holy Ruh Allah, just like your fathers did before you.

metadata.item: Here and in the next verse, the word fathers is not literal, but means ancestors.

verse.content: Your fathers persecuted all the anbiya. They killed the people who previously predicted the coming of the righteous al-masih. And now you have betrayed him and led him to death!
The Tawrat was revealed to you by angels, but you did not obey it!
When they heard this, the council was very angry. The ground their teeth at him in fury.
But Stephen was filled with Holy Ruh Allah. He looked to heaven and saw Isa standing at the right side of Glorious, Majestic Allah.

metadata.item: This refers to the Arabic names Al-Majid and Al-Jalil, two of the 99 names of Allah.

verse.content: He said, "Look! I see heaven opened and sayyid al-bashar standing at the right side of Allah."
When they heard that, they shouted and covered their ears. They all attacked him together.
Then they took him out of Al-Quds and started stoning him.
Stephen was praying in dua' as they were stoning him, "Isa, my mawla, receive my spirit!"
Then he fell on his knees and shouted loudly, "Allahumma, do not punish them for their sin against me!" After he said that, he died.

Talut was in agreement with killing him. On that day, a severe persecution against the umma of chosen people began in Al-Quds. They were all scattered and emigrated to Yahudia and Samaria. But the hawariyun remained in Al-Quds.

metadata.item: This is not Talut, the first king of Bani Israil. This Talut, also known as Saul, later became known as Paul.

verse.content: Some Yahud who were pious buried Stephen and mourned greatly over him.
But Talut pursued the umma of chosen people to destroy them. He entered one house after another, arrested the believers (both men and women), and cast them into prison.
The emigrants abroad went round everywhere telling the good news of the word of Allah.
So Philip went to the major city in Samaria. There he preached about al-masih.

metadata.item: In this chapter, this is Philip, the leader chosen in chapter 6, not the hawari Philip.

verse.content: The crowds heard his words, saw his miracles, and responded to his message.
The evil spirits screamed and went out of many touched people, and many paralyzed people and lame people were healed.
Great joy covered that city.
There was a magician there named Simon. He had amazed the Samaritans with his magic. He claimed to be great.
They all followed him, both young and old. They said, "He is the power from Allah called 'great'."
They followed him because his magic amazed them
But when they believed the good news of Philip about the kingdom of Allah and the name of Isa al-masih, the men and women did the ghusl of faith.
Even Simon believed, did ghusl, and accompanied Philip. Simon was amazed at the great ayat and miracles.
The hawariyun in Al-Quds heard that the people of Samaria had received the word of Allah, so they sent Peter and Yahya to them.
When they came, they prayed in dua' that they would receive the gift of Holy Ruh Allah,
whom Allah had not yet sent down on any of them. But they had done ghusl in the name of our mawla Isa.
So Peter and Yahya put their hands on them and they received Holy Ruh Allah.
Simon saw how the Ruh was given by putting the hands of the hawariyun on them, and he offered them money.
He said, "Give me this kind of authority, so that Allah will send his Holy Ruh on the people I put my hands on."
But Peter told him, "May there be a curse on you and your money. You thought that you could buy the gift of Allah with money!
You have no portion or part in this message, because your heart is not straight before Allah!
Repent from your polytheism and ask Allah for forgiveness for the intents of your heart.
For I see that you are jealous with bitterness and a slave to sins!"
Simon answered him, "Please ask Allah to forgive me, so that nothing you have said will affect me."
Then after they gave shahada to the word of our mawla and announced it to the people, they returned to Al-Quds. They gave the good news in many villages of the Samaritans on their way.
Rabb Al-Alamin sent his angel to Philip, and he commanded him, "Get up and go south from Al-Quds on the desert road to Gaza."
So he got up and went, and he saw an Ethiopian eunuch, the minister of finance for Candace (queen of Ethiopia). He had done hajj to Al-Quds to worship.
He was returning in his chariot to his country and reading the scroll of the nabi Shaya.

metadata.item: Scrolls in those days were rare and expensive.

verse.content: The Ruh said to Philip, "Go and accompany the chariot."
So Philip went quickly to him and heard him reading the scroll of the nabi Shaya, and he asked him, "Do you understand what you are reading?"
The minister answered him, "How can I understand without anyone guiding me?" So he invited Philip to get on the chariot and to sit with him.

He was reading these verses, "He was like a sheep that was led to be slaughtered, and like a lamb that was silent in the hands of the people who would shear it. So he did not open his mouth with a word.
In humiliation, his rights were taken away. So who can tell about his descendants? For his life ended on the earth."

metadata.item: This is a quotation from the Tawrat, Shaya 53:7-8

verse.content: So the eunuch spoke to Philip and asked for an explanation. "Please, whom does he predict? Is it about himself or someone else?"
Philip opened his mouth and starting from those verses, he began to tell him the good news of Isa.
Then they passed on the road by a place that had water, so the eunuch said,
"Look! Here is some water! What prevents me from doing the ghusl of faith?"
So he ordered the chariot to stop. Then Philip and the eunuch went down into the water and Philip did ghusl for him.
When they got out of the water, the Ruh of Al-Mawla took Philip. The eunuch did not see him again, and he continued joyfully on his way.
But Philip found himself in Azotus, and on his way, he told the good news in all the cities until he arrived at Caesarea.
But Talut continued to overflow with threats to kill the followers of our mawla, and he went to the chief habr.
He asked him for authority to arrest everyone he found belonging to al-sirat in the Yahudi houses of salat in Damascus, both men and women believers, and to bring them in chains to Al-Quds.
When Talut was approaching Damascus on the road, suddenly, light from heaven shined around him.
He fell on the ground and heard a sound calling to him, "Talut, Talut, why are you persecuting me?"
Talut asked, "Who are you, my master?" He answered him, "I am Isa, and you are persecuting me.
But get up and go into the city. You will be told what you must do."
The travelers stood silently. They heard the sound, but they did not see anyone.
Then Talut got up from the ground. He opened his eyes, but he could not see anything. So they led him by his hand into Damascus.
He remained blind for three days, and he did not eat or drink anything.
In Damascus, there was a follower of Isa name Ananias. His mawla called him in a vision, "Ananias!" He answered him, "At your service, my mawla!"
His mawla told him, "Get up and go to the street known as Straight, and ask in the house of Yahuda for a man named Talut from Tarsus. You will find him there doing salat.
In a vision, he has seen a man named Ananias coming to him and putting his hands on him so that he can see again."
Ananias answered, "My mawla, I have heard from many people about this man and all the evil deeds he has done against your holy followers in Al-Quds.
He came here with authority from the leading ahbar to arrest all the people who call on your name."
His mawla answered him, "Go. I have chosen him as a messenger to carry my name to the nations of kuffar, to kings, and to Bani Israil.
And I will show him how much he must suffer for the sake of my name."

So Ananias went, entered the house, and put his hands on Talut. He said, "Brother Talut, our mawla appeared to you on the road. He is Isa, who sent me to you so that you could see again and be filled with Holy Ruh Allah."

metadata.item: The word brother here is not literal. Here it means a fellow believer.

verse.content: Immediately, coatings fell from the eyes of Talut, and he recovered his sight. After that he did the ghusl of faith.
Then he ate and was strengthened. He stayed several days with the followers in Damascus.
Immediately, he began to preach in the houses of salat. He gave shahada that Isa was the beloved amir of Allah.

Everyone who heard him was amazed. They asked each other, "Is not this the man who was destroying those who call on this name in Al-Quds? And he has now come to arrest them and take them chained to the leading ahbar."
But Talut became stronger in his preaching, and silenced the arguments of Al-Yahud in Damascus, proving that al-masih, the expected king, was Isa.
After many days of that, Al-Yahud consulted with each other, and decided to kill him.
But their plot was exposed. They were watching the gates of the city night and day to kill him.
But his supporters took him at night, and lowered him in a basket from an opening in the wall of the city.

metadata.item: Some houses were built into the wall that surrounded the city and had a window that faced out of the city.

verse.content: When he arrived at Al-Quds, he tried to join the followers, but everyone was afraid of him. They did not believe that he was really a follower of Isa.
But Barnabas took him and presented him to the hawariyun. He told them how he had seen our mawla, who spoke to him on the road, and how he had been bold in telling the message of Isa in Damascus.
After that, Talut remained with the followers in Al-Quds. He walked around with them publicly, and preached boldly in the name of our mawla.
He spoke to the Greek-speaking Yahud and argued with them, but they tried to kill him.
When the brothers learned that, they took him to the port of Caesarea and sent him by sea to Tarsus.

metadata.item: The word brothers here is not literal. Here it means fellow believers.

verse.content: Then the umma of chosen people had the baraka of peace in Yahudia, Al-Jalil, and Samaria. It was strengthened, it walked in the fear of Allah and the aid of Holy Ruh Allah, and it multiplied.
Peter went around the whole country, and visited the holy believers in the town of Lydda.
He found a paralyzed man named Aeneas there. He had not moved from his mat for eight years.
Peter told him, "Aeneas, Isa al-masih has healed you! Get up and make your bed with your hands!" He got up immediately.
Everyone living in Lydda and Sharon saw him, and they were guided to our mawla.
In Joppa, there was a follower named Tabitha, (her name means gazelle). Her life was characterized by good works and giving alms to needy people.
She became sick in those days and died. So they washed her and put her in a room in the upper floor.

metadata.item: This was a burial custom.

verse.content: The followers heard that Peter was in Lydda, which was near to them. So they sent two of their men to beg him, "Please come quickly to us!"

Peter went with them, and they took him to the room in the upper floor. All the widows had surrounded her and were crying. They showed him the robes and clothes that "Gazelle" had woven when she had been with them.
So he sent all of them out, kneeled and prayed in dua'. Then he turned to the body and said, "Tabitha, get up!" So she opened her eyes, and when she saw Peter, she sat up.
He took her hand and lifted her. Then he called the holy brothers and the widows and presented her alive to them.
The news spread through the whole city of Joppa, and many people believed in our mawla Isa.
Peter remained several days in Joppa with a tanner of skins named Simon.
In Caesarea, there was a Roman officer who was the leader of one hundred soldiers. He was part of the Italian regiment, and his name was Cornelius.
He and his family were pious and feared Allah. He gave alms generously to the people and prayed in dua' to Allah continually.

metadata.item: Al-Yahud.

verse.content: One afternoon, he saw an angel clearly in a vision. He appeared in front of him and called him, "Cornelius!"
Cornelius stared at the angel and said in fear, "Yes, sir?" The angel told him, "Your dua' and your alms have risen to Allah, the All-hearing and All-knowing.

metadata.item: This refers to the Arabic names Al-Sami and Al-Alim, two of the 99 names of Allah.

verse.content: So send men to Joppa, and bring Simon, who is called Peter.
He is staying as a guest of a tanner named Simon, whose house is on the shore of the sea."

metadata.item: Tanners treated skins of dead animals so they could be used as leather or clothing.
Joppa was on the coast of the Mediterranean Sea.

verse.content: Then the angel who had spoken to him left him. So Cornelius called two slaves and a pious soldier who helped him.
He told them everything that had happened, and sent them to Joppa.
On the next day, while they were approaching Joppa, Peter went up to the roof to do his noon salat.
He was very hungry and wanted some food. While they were bringing it to him, he fell unconscious. He saw
heaven open. Something like a long, wide sheet was lowered onto the earth by its four sides. In it were all kinds of animals, reptiles and birds.

metadata.item: Most animals, some birds, and all reptiles were unclean to Al-Yahud based on the Tawrat, Leviticus 11 and Deuteronomy 14.

verse.content: Then a voice shouted to him, "Get up, Peter. Slaughter and eat!"
Peter said, "No, master. I have never eaten anything haraam or unclean!"
The voice spoke to him again, "Do not consider as unclean what Allah has made tahir!"
This happened three times, and immediately, the sheet was raised up to heaven.
Peter remained puzzled about the meaning of the vision he had seen. Then the delegation from Cornelius came and arrived at the gate of Simon, after they had asked directions to the house.
They asked if Simon who is called Peter was staying as a guest with them.
While that was happening, Peter was still thinking about the vision. Then Ruh Allah told him, "Look! Three men are looking for you.
Get up, go down to them, and accompany them without hesitation, because I have sent them."
Peter went down and said to the men, "I am the person you are asking about. Why have you come?"

They told him, "A holy angel came to Cornelius, who is a righteous, pious officer with a good reputation with all the umma of Al-Yahud. He commanded him to send you an invitation to his house to hear your message."
So Peter hosted them. The next morning, he went with them, along with some brothers from Joppa.
On the second day, he entered Caesarea with them. Cornelius was waiting for their arrival, and he had gathered his relatives and close friends.
When Peter entered, Cornelius fell at his feet and bowed to him.
Peter raised him and told him, "Get up. I am only a man!"
Peter entered and was talking to him. He saw many people gathered there.
Peter spoke to them, "You know that mixing with or visiting other races is haraam for a Yahudi. But Allah showed me that it is not halal for me to consider anyone haraam or unclean.
Therefore, I did not object to coming to you, but responded to your invitation. Why did you call for me to come?"
Cornelius answered him, "I was doing afternoon salat about this time four days ago, and suddenly a man with shining clothes appeared in front of me.
He told me: Cornelius, Allah is All-hearing of your dua' and All-knowing of your alms.

metadata.item: This refers to the Arabic names Al-Sami and Al-Alim, two of the 99 names of Allah.

verse.content: Send people to Joppa and invite Simon, who is called Peter. He is staying as a guest with Simon the tanner, whose house is on the shore of the sea.
So I sent a delegation to you immediately, and you have honored us by coming. We have gathered here in the presence of Allah to hear from you what Rabb Al-Alamin has commanded you."
So Peter began to speak to them. He said, "I truly see now that Allah is not prejudiced against anyone.
He has rida toward everyone who fears him and does good from any umma.
You know the word that Allah sent to Bani Israil. It is the good news of peace through Isa, al-masih, master of everything.
You also know what happened in all Yahudia, beginning from Al-Jalil after the ghusl of repentance that Yahya called people to do.
Allah appointed Isa Al-Nasiri by his Holy Ruh and power, and Isa went around in the country doing good works and healing people whom Iblis tormented. Allah aided him.
We are eye witnesses of all his ayat in Al-Quds and Yahudia. Then they executed him by hanging him on a tree.

metadata.item: The cross was made of wood from a tree.

verse.content: On the third day, Allah resurrected him alive and made him appear.
He did not appear to people in general, but to us, whom Allah chose to give shahada. We ate and drank with him after he was resurrected alive from death.
And he commanded us to give shahada to people and warn them that Allah has appointed him as judge of living people and dead people.
All the anbiya gave shahada that forgiveness of sins is given through the name of Isa to everyone who believes and trusts in him."
As Peter was saying this, Allah sent his Holy Ruh on everyone who heard the message.
The Yahudi believers who accompanied Peter were amazed how Allah had poured the gift of his Holy Ruh on people who were outside their umma also.
They heard them speaking in languages other than their languages and giving praise to Allah. Peter said,
"Can anyone prevent these people from doing the ghusl of faith, since Allah has sent down on them his Holy Ruh like he did for us?"
Then he commanded them to do the ghusl of faith in the name of Isa al-masih. So they asked Peter to stay with them a few days.
The hawariyun and the brothers in Yahudia heard that people from other nations had received the word of Allah.
So the brothers of the umma of the circumcised people criticized Peter as soon as he arrived to Al-Quds.

metadata.item: Al-Yahud.

verse.content: They said, "You visited people who are not circumcised, and you shared their unclean food with them."
So Peter told them everything that had happened in order. He said,
"While I was doing salat in Joppa, I was in an unconscious vision. I saw something like a long, wide sheet being lowered from heaven by its four corners. It was lowered to me.
And I stared at it, and saw animals of the earth: wild beasts, reptiles, and birds.
I heard a voice commanding me: Peter, get up, slaughter, and eat!
I answered: 'No, my master. Nothing haraam and unclean has ever entered my mouth!'
The heavenly voice told me again: Do not consider what Allah has made tahir as haraam!
This happened three times, and then everything was withdrawn to heaven.
At the same instant, three men arrived to the house I was staying in. They were a delegation from Caesarea.
Ruh Allah commanded me to accompany them without hesitation. These six brothers went with me. So we entered the house of the man.
He told us how he had seen an angel standing in his house, who commanded him, 'Send people to Joppa and bring Simon, who is called Peter.
He will speak a message by which you and your family will be saved.'
As soon as I began to speak to them, Allah sent down his Holy Ruh on them, just like he sent it down on us in the beginning.
And I remembered the words of our mawla Isa: Yahya did ghusl for people into water as a ghusl of repentance. But you will do ghusl by Holy Ruh Allah.
Allah sent down on them the same gift he sent down on us when we believed in our mawla Isa al-masih. So who am I to object to the sirat of Allah?"
The critics stopped their criticism and praised the glory of Allah. They said, "Allah, the accepter of repentance, has given repentance leading to life, even to people who are not Yahud!"

metadata.item: This refers to the Arabic name Al-Tawwab, one of the 99 names of Allah.

verse.content: Meanwhile, the followers who were scattered because of the persecution that came from the martyrdom of Stephen had reached Phoenicia, Cyprus, and Antioch. They spoke the message only to Yahud.
But some of the brothers from Cyrene came to Antioch and started speaking to Greeks also. They told them the good news of our mawla Isa.
The hand of Rabb Al-Alamin was aiding them, and many people believed and were guided to our mawla.

metadata.item: The word 'hand' is not literal. Allah does not have a body. Hand here refers to the power of Allah.

verse.content: The umma of chosen people in Al-Quds heard the news, so they sent Barnabas to Antioch.
When he arrived, he realized that the grace of Allah was on them. So he rejoiced, and he encouraged them to hold fast to our mawla with determination in their hearts.
Barnabas was a good man, full of Holy Ruh Allah, and strong in trust. As a result, a large crowd of people were guided to our mawla.
Then Barnabas went to Tarsus, looking for Talut.

metadata.item: He probably remembered that part of the message of Talut was to speak to nations of kuffar.

verse.content: He found him and brought him to Antioch. So they gathered with the umma of chosen people for a whole year, and they taught large crowds. The people from Antioch called the followers 'Christians' for the first time, mocking them.
In those days, brothers whom Allah had given the gift of prophecy came from Al-Quds to Antioch.
One of them, Agabus, got up and prophesied by revelation of Ruh Allah that there would be a severe famine over all the inhabited earth. This later happened during the reign of Caesar Claudius.
So the followers decided to send aid to the brothers in Yahudia. Each person gave alms according to his capability.

metadata.item: Many of them in Al-Quds had sold lands and property (chapter 4:34-37) so they would be especially vulnerable in a famine.

verse.content: They did this, and sent it to the leaders of the believers with Barnabas and Talut.
In those days, King Herod Agrippa arrested some of the umma of chosen people to harm them.
He killed Yacoub, the brother of Yahya with a sword.
When he saw that this gave rida to Al-Yahud, he arrested Peter also. It was the beginning of the Eid of Unleavened Bread.
After he arrested him, he put him in prison and delivered him to four teams of soldiers to guard him. He intended to do a trial in front of the people after the Passover Eid.

metadata.item: Each team had four soldiers.

verse.content: An angel from Rabb Al-Alamin appeared, and light shined in the prison cell. He woke Peter up by hitting him on his side, and commanded him, "Get up quickly!" Then the chains fell off his hands.

Peter followed him and went out, but he did not know that what the angel was doing was real. He thought he was seeing a vision.

They passed by the first guard and then the second, and then they reached the iron gate into the city, which opened by itself. So they went in and walked the length of one street. Suddenly the angel left him.
Peter regained consciousness and said, "Now I know certainly that Al-Mawla has sent his angel and rescued me from Herod and from everything that the Yahudi people were expecting."

He knocked on the gate, and a maid named Rhoda went out to listen.
She recognized the voice of Peter, and did not open the gate because she was so happy. She went inside the house and told the people who were gathered that Peter was at the gate.
They said, "You are crazy!" But she insisted, so they said, "Well, then it is his angel!"
But Peter continued knocking on the gate. When they opened it for him and saw him, they were totally amazed.

He motioned for them to be quiet, and described to them how Al-Mawla had brought him out of the prison. He told them, "Tell Yacoub the son of the mother of Isa and the brothers about these matters." Then he went out to another place.

One day, we were on our way to the place of dua' and a slave girl met us. A jinni had touched her and given her the ability to prophesy about hidden things. Her masters gained a lot of money from this prophecy.
She continued walking behind us and shouting, "These men are slaves of Allah, the Most High. They are telling you good news of the sirat of salvation."

verse.content: She continued doing this every day. Paul was bothered and turned to the jinni in her and told it, "I command you in the name of Isa al-masih to come out of her." So the jinni came out of her immediately.
Her masters realized that their hope of gain was gone, and they grabbed Paul and Silas and dragged them into the market to the court.
They brought them to the judges and said, "These two men are Yahud. They are stirring up trouble in our city.
They are spreading practices that are forbidden for us to accept or do, since we are Romans!"
Everyone attacked them, and the judges stripped off their clothes and ordered that they be beaten with rods.
So they beat them a lot, and threw them into jail. Then they ordered the jailer to guard them carefully.
So the jailer executed the order and put them in the inner jail. He chained their feet to a board tied to the ground.
At midnight, Paul and Silas were praying and praising Allah and singing. The prisoners were listening to them.
Then there was a strong earthquake that shook the foundations of the jail, and all the doors suddenly opened. And the chains of all the prisoners were opened.
After the jailer awakened, he saw the doors of the jail were opened, so he took out his sword to kill himself. He thought that the prisoners had escaped.

metadata.item: If his prisoners escaped, he would be punished by death, and he preferred a quick death by the sword than a slow, painful death by execution.

verse.content: So Paul shouted to him loudly, "Do not harm yourself. We are all here!"
He asked for a lamp, went to them quickly, and fell trembling on the ground at the feet of Paul and Silas.
Then he brought them out and asked them, "Sirs, what must I do to be saved?"
They answered him, "Believe in our mawla Isa, and trust in him. Then you and your family will be saved."
They told him and all his family the good news of the word of our mawla.
At that hour of the night, he washed their wounds, and they immediately did the ghusl of faith for the jailer and all his family.
Then he received them as guests in his house and fed them. He and his family rejoiced because they had all become believers in Allah.
When the sun came up, the judges sent the police with an order to the jailer, "Let those two men be released."
The jailer told Paul, "The judges have ordered for you both to be released, so you may go out in peace."

But Paul said, "They beat us in public without a trial, even though we are Romans. Then they put us in prison. So now do they want to let us go in secret? No. Let them come themselves and take us out."
The police told the judges these words, and they were afraid, because they heard that they were Romans.
So they came and begged them to leave the city.
So they left the prison, entered the house of Lydia, met the brothers, encouraged them, and then left the city.
They passed by Amphipolis and Apollonia before they arrived to Thessalonica, where there was a Yahudi house of salat.
Paul entered it as was his custom, and for three Sabts, he discussed the kitab of Allah with the people who were there.
He explained to them clearly that the sufferings of al-masih and his resurrection alive from death were predestined matters. He said, "The expected al-masih is Isa, whom I am telling you about."
Some of them were convinced and followed Paul and Silas, along with a large crowd of pious Greeks and a number of leading women.

Al-Yahud were jealous, and they gathered some evil, useless men from the street. They formed a mob and stirred up a riot and chaos in the city. Afterwards, they attacked the house of Jason, looking for Paul and Silas. They hoped to bring them out to the mob.

verse.content: But they did not find them. So they dragged Jason and some of the brothers to the court. They screamed, "Those men who have turned this world upside down by causing dissension have come to our city, too.

verse.content: Jason has received them, and they are all disobeying the orders of Caesar. They confess another king named Isa!"
